       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-18">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Usual Suspects" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/79e7/5165/4337/0a3b/7a44/IMG_0283.JPG?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          19
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          While the line-up team-up is a great concept, director
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/bryan-singer/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Bryan Singer
          </a>
          and writer
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/christopher-mcquarrie/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Christopher McQuarrie
          </a>
          's super-twisted, uber-cool crime thriller attains true greatness through its supernatural-horror-style backdrop, conjuring a phantom menace "Keyser Soze" who terrifies even the most hardened criminal.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/usual-suspects-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Usual Suspects
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-19">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Psycho" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/7abf/3ebe/4795/339c/e267/IMG_0282.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          20
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          The movie Universal originally didn't want
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/alfred-hitchcock/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Hitchcock
          </a>
          to make not only turned out to be a hands-down masterpiece but also effectively invented a genre: the psycho-killer slasher movie. No longer were movie monsters just big, hairy wolf-men, or vampires, or swampy fish-things. They could now look completely normal. They could be the guy sat right next to you, in fact...
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/psycho-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Psycho
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-10">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-20">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="L.A. Confidential" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/7b55/dbee/afab/a168/febc/IMG_0280.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          21
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Twenty years on, and still nobody's made a better
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/james-ellroy/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           James Ellroy
          </a>
          adaptation than
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/curtis-hanson/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Curtis Hanson
          </a>
          and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/brian-helgeland/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Brian Helgeland
          </a>
          's boldly streamlined take on the heavy-plotted third novel in Ellroy's 'L.A. Quartet'. Its spot-on casting hardly hurt, including
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/russell-crowe/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Russell Crowe
          </a>
          as conscience-discovering bruiser Bud White and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/guy-pearce/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Guy Pearce
          </a>
          as ramrod rookie Ed Exley.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/l-confidential-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of L.A. Confidential
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-21">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="E.T. � The Extra Terrestrial" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/7c42/f590/5e2d/0306/47b8/IMG_0279.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          22
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          With the "Amblin" style so regularly referenced these days (most successfully in the Duffer brothers'
          <em>
           Stranger Things
          </em>
          ), it's worth reminding ourselves that it was never more perfectly encapsulated than in
          <em>
           E.T
          </em>
          .: a children's adventure which carefully beds its supernatural elements in an utterly relatable everykid world, and tempers its cuter, more sentimental moments with a true sense of jeopardy.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/et-extra-terrestrial-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of E.T.
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-11">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-22">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="In The Mood For Love" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/7c9b/dbee/af0d/9568/fec4/IMG_0278.JPG?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          23
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Years before battling Shang-Chi in the MCU, Hong Kong acting legend
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/tony-leung/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Tony Leung
          </a>
          was director
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/wong-kar-wai/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Wong Kar-wai
          </a>
          's greatest muse in gorgeous, simmering masterpieces like
          <em>
           Chungking Express
          </em>
          ,
          <em>
           Happy Together
          </em>
          � and this remarkable romance, perhaps their greatest collaboration. Leung plays a journalist renting an apartment in 1960s Hong Kong; his neighbour, played by Maggie Cheung, appears as lonely and lost as he is. It soon emerges their spouses are having an affair, and a romance of stolen glances and intimate longing begins to emerge. Love stories are rarely as ravishingly beautiful (or deeply influential) as this.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/mood-love-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of In The Mood For Love
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-23">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Star Wars: Return Of The Jedi" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/7d68/5909/d0c9/364c/8722/IMG_0277.JPG?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          24
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          In this post-
          <em>
           Phantom Menace
          </em>
          world, the Ewoks don't seem quite so egregious, do they? Endor's teddy-bear guerillas might have got sneered at, but they shouldn't blind us to Jedi's assets: the explosive team-re-gathering opening; the crazily high-speed forest chase; and that marvellously edited three-way climactic battle that dextrously flipped us between lightsabers, spaceships and a ferocious (albeit fuzzy) forest conflict.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/star-wars-episode-vi-return-jedi-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Return Of The Jedi
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-12">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-24">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Arrival" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/7df7/3ebe/4778/9b9c/e284/IMG_0276.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          25
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/denis-villeneuve/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Denis Villeneuve
          </a>
          's empathic, perception-bending alien visitation drama is a delicately crafted modern rework of
          <em>
           The Day The Earth Stood Still
          </em>
          , except the extra-terrestrials are truly otherworldly and there's the sky-high obstacle that is the language barrier. With its message that open-minded communication enables us to realise the things we have in common with those who appear vastly different, it feels like genuinely compulsive viewing for these troubled times.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/arrival-2-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Arrival
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-25">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-2053875047 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="A Quiet Place" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/8191/3ebe/4762/8f9c/e2aa/IMG_0275.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          26
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Take a simple concept (don't make a sound, or aliens will get you), a stellar cast (
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/emily-blunt/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Emily Blunt
          </a>
          , Millicent Simmonds, Noah Jupe) and a director with a laser-sharp vision (
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/john-krasinski/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           John Krasinski
          </a>
          ) and what do you get? As it turns out, one of the most innovative, refreshing, unbearably tense horror movies of the 21st century. From the second it starts, the imposed silence of
          <em>
           A Quiet Place
          </em>
          makes it a revelatory cinematic experience � as the Abbott family pad gently around their home, the store, the woods, you feel in your bones that one wrong step equals disaster. The (loudly) ticking time bomb of imminent childbirth sets the scene for a stellar scary finale, but it's the deeply endearing family dynamic that sets this apart.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/quiet-place-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of A Quiet Place
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-13">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-26">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3008095092 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Trainspotting" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/825d/dbee/afae/3e68/feee/IMG_0274.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          27
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          For their follow up to the superb
          <em>
           Shallow Grave
          </em>
          ,
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/danny-boyle/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Danny Boyle
          </a>
          (director),
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/andrew-macdonald/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Andrew Macdonald
          </a>
          (producer) and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/john-hodge/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           John Hodge
          </a>
          (screenwriter) foolhardily elected to film the supposedly unfilmable:
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/irvine-welsh/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Irvine Welsh
          </a>
          's scrappy, episodic, multi-perspective novel about Edinburgh low-lives. The result couldn't have been more triumphant: the cinematic incarnation of 'Cool Britannia' came with a kick-ass soundtrack, and despite some dark subject matter, came with a punch-the-air uplifting pay-off.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="http://empireonline.com/movies/reviews/trainspotting-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Trainspotting
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-27">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Mulholland Drive" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/8312/3ebe/47ea/0f9c/e2b5/IMG_0273.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          28
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/david-lynch/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           David Lynch
          </a>
          messes with Hollywood itself in a mystery tale that's as twisted as the road it's named after, while presenting Tinseltown as both Dream Factory and a realm of Nightmares. It also put
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/naomi-watts/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Naomi Watts
          </a>
          on the map; her audition scene remains as stunning as it was 20 years ago.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/mulholland-drive-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Mulholland Drive
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-14">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-28">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Rear Window" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/8412/f590/5eb0/3206/47f2/IMG_0272.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          29
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Photographer LB Jeffries (
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/james-stewart/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           James Stewart
          </a>
          ) is on sick leave, with a broken leg. He's bored to tears, so he starts spying on his neighbours. Then he witnesses a murder. OR DOES HE?
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/alfred-hitchcock/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Alfred Hitchcock
          </a>
          really knew how to take a corker of a premise and spin it into a peerless thriller (that's why they called him The Master Of Suspense), but
          <em>
           Rear Window
          </em>
          also deserves praise for an astonishing set build: that entire Greenwich Village courtyard was constructed at Paramount Studios, complete with a drainage system that could handle all the rain.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/rear-window-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Rear Window
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-29">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Up" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/84db/3ebe/47eb/e69c/e2c2/IMG_0271.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          30
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          A lot has been said about the opening to
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/pete-docter/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Pete Docter
          </a>
          's Pixar masterpiece, and rightly so, wringing tears from the hardest of hearts with a wordless sequence set to
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/michael-giacchino/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Michael Giacchino
          </a>
          's lovely, Oscar-winning score that charts the ups and downs of a couple's marriage. Yet while the majority of the film is more of a straight-ahead adventure tale (albeit one with a wacky bird and talking dogs), that doesn't make it any less satisfying. And let's be honest � the story of a man who uses balloons to float his house to a foreign land, accidentally picking up a young wilderness explorer scout as he does, feels perfectly Pixar.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/movie-2-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Up
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-15">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-30">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-2460571505 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/857e/5909/d0db/e74c/8768/IMG_0270.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          31
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Having
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/phil-lord/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Phil Lord
          </a>
          and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/chris-miller/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Chris Miller
          </a>
          's names on a movie is regularly the guarantee of something great, but the full team behind this animated marvel (in both upper- and lower-case senses of the word) is what makes it work.
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/bob-persichetti/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Bob Persichetti
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/peter-ramsey/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Peter Ramsey
          </a>
          , and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/rodney-rothman/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Rodney Rothman
          </a>
          all added something as directors (with Rothman co-writing alongside Lord) and their animators whipped up a visually dynamic, exciting, and heartwarming adventure that literally spans multiverses before the MCU introduced it. Bringing Miles Morales to the screen was a masterstroke, and
          <a href="http:///people/shameik-moore/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_self">
           Shameik Moore
          </a>
          's vocal work gives him buckets of charm.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/spider-man-spider-verse-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-31">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-1477721792 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Inglourious Basterds" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/86bb/dbee/af72/ce68/ff1c/IMG_0269.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          32
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          From its Sergio Leone-riffing opening to its insanely OTT, history-rewriting finale,
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/quentin-tarantino/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Tarantino'
          </a>
          s World War II caper never once fails to surprise and entertain. As ever, though, QT's at his best in claustrophobic situations, with the tavern scene ramping up the tension to almost unbearable levels.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/inglourious-basterds-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Inglourious Basterds
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-16">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-32">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Lady Bird" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/874f/3ebe/4715/069c/e2d3/IMG_0268.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          33
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          With her directorial debut, the wry wit and emotional potency of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/greta-gerwig/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Greta Gerwig
          </a>
          's previous work came even sharper into focus � telling a beautifully nuanced coming-of-age story about mothers, daughters, and the hometowns you yearn to leave, only for them to be truly appreciated in the rear-view mirror.
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/saoirse-ronan/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Saoirse Ronan
          </a>
          is perfectly precocious as the not-always-likeable Christine 'Lady Bird' McPherson, experiencing fractured friendships, first fuckboys, and fateful fumbles in her final year of high school in 2003 Sacramento.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/lady-bird-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Lady Bird
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-33">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Singin' In The Rain" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/87e5/5165/432a/5b3b/7ac2/IMG_0267.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          34
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          A joyous, vibrant Technicolor celebration of the movies, that's such an essential viewing experience there should perhaps be a law that it feature in every DVD and Blu-ray collection. It's no mere Hollywood self-love exercise, though. As star Don Lockwood,
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/gene-kelly/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Gene Kelly
          </a>
          brings a sense of exasperation at the film industry's diva-indulging daftness, making it a gentle piss-take, too.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/singin-rain-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Singin' In The Rain
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-17">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-34">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-4247561351 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/8874/f590/5eaa/9306/4815/IMG_0266.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          35
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Ken Kesey's era-defining novel was in good hands with screenwriters Lawrence Hauben and Bo Goldman, not to mention director
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/milos-forman/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Milos Forman
          </a>
          : five Oscars were testament to that, including one for
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/jack-nicholson/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Jack Nicholson
          </a>
          , who's arguably never been better as a man destined to be chewed up by the unfeeling system (ditto
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/louise-fletcher/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Louise Fletcher
          </a>
          , who represents that system in the form of Nurse Ratched).
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/one-flew-cuckoo-nest-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of One Flew Over The Cuckoo's Nest
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-35">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Seven Samurai" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/8ae9/3ebe/473d/239c/e2f5/qvZ91FwMq6O47VViAr8vZNQz3WI.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          36
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          A film so good they remade it twice � as
          <em>
           The Magnificent Seven
          </em>
          , then as
          <em>
           Battle Beyond The Stars
          </em>
          . Or four times, arguably... if you count
          <em>
           A Bug's Life
          </em>
          and the remake of
          <em>
           The Magnificent Seven
          </em>
          . You could also make the case that
          <em>
           Avengers Assemble
          </em>
          is a version, too. The point is this:
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/akira-kurosawa/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Akira Kurosawa
          </a>
          's epic, 16th century-set drama about a motley gang of warriors uniting to save a village from bandits couldn't be more influential. Cinema simply wouldn't be the same without it.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/seven-samurai-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_self">
           Read Empire's review of Seven Samurai
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-18">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-36">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="La La Land" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/8923/5909/d051/f14c/8788/IMG_0265.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          37
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          As much a technical marvel as it is an acting tour-de-force,
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/damien-chazelle/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Damien Chazelle
          </a>
          's Los Angeles love letter proved a ridiculously easy movie to fall in love with, even for those who may have grumbled that they weren't really into musicals before sitting down to watch it. Go on, admit it: You're still humming "Another Day Of Sun", aren't you?
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/la-la-land-review-2/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of La La Land
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-37">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Get Out" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/897b/dbee/af58/a168/ff31/IMG_0264.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          38
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Even given the darker tones of a few Key And Peele sketches, no one could have predicted that
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/jordan-peele/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Jordan Peele
          </a>
          would place himself on track to become a modern master of horror. And it all started with this, the Oscar-winning kick-off to his film career in which
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/daniel-kaluuya/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Daniel Kaluuya
          </a>
          's Chris meets his girlfriend Rose's (
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/allison-williams/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Allison Williams
          </a>
          ) parents and discovers some truly shocking secrets. White guilt, specific racism, slavery and more blend into a socially conscious terror tale that rings every note with pitch-perfect accuracy. You'll never look at a cup of tea the same way again.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/get-2-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Get Out
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-19">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-38">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Lawrence Of Arabia" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/8bb0/dbee/afde/0568/ff45/IMG_0263.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          39
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          If you only ever see one
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/david-lean/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           David Lean
          </a>
          movie... well, don't. Watch as many as you can. But if you really insist on only seeing one
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/peter-otoole/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           David Lean
          </a>
          movie, then make sure it's
          <em>
           Lawrence Of Arabia
          </em>
          , the movie that put both the "sweeping" and the "epic" into "sweeping epic" with its breath-taking depiction of T.E. Lawrence's (
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/peter-otoole/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Peter O'Toole
          </a>
          ) Arab-uniting efforts against the German-allied Turks during World War I. It's a different world to the one we're in now, of course, but Lean's mastery of expansive storytelling does much to smooth out any elements (such as
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/alec-guinness/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Alec Guinness
          </a>
          playing an Arab) that may rankle modern sensibilities.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/lawrence-arabia-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Lawrence Of Arabia
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-39">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Pan's Labyrinth" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/8c75/5909/d024/fc4c/879c/IMG_0262.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          40
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/guillermo-del-toro/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Guillermo Del Toro
          </a>
          's fairy tale for grown-ups, as pull-no-punches brutal as it is gorgeously, baroquely fantastical. There's an earthy, primal feel to his fairy-world here, alien and threatening rather than gasp-inducing and 'magical', thanks in no small part to the truly cheese-dream nightmarish demon-things Del Toro conjures up, sans CGI, with the assistance of performer
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/doug-jones/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Doug Jones
          </a>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/pan-labyrinth-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Pan's Labyrinth
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">

       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-40">

            <img alt="Hot Fuzz" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/8cf3/5909/d066/d84c/87a0/IMG_0261.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>

         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          41
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->

         </span>

        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/edgar-wright/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Edgar Wright
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/simon-pegg/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Simon Pegg
          </a>
          and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/nick-frost/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Nick Frost
          </a>
          's tribute to big American cop movies isn't just a great fish-out-of-water comedy, sending high-achieving London policeman Nick Angel (Pegg) to the most boring place in the UK (or so it seems). It also manages to wring every last drip of funny out of executing spot-on bombastic, Bayhem-style action in a sleepy English small-town setting.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/hot-fuzz-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Hot Fuzz
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>

       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-41">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Moonlight" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/8dc6/5909/d069/db4c/87a7/IMG_0259.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          42
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Adapted from Tarell Alvin's play
          <em>
           In Moonlight, Black Boys Look Blue
          </em>
          ,
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/barry-jenkins/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Barry Jenkins
          </a>
          ' Oscar-winning drama is the kind of film that seeps under your skin and stays there. Tracking one man's life in three stages, and the love (and lack of it) that made him who he is,
          <em>
           Moonlight
          </em>
          evokes a sense of intimacy so palpable, the camera's gaze into the characters' eyes so intense, you can't bear to look away.
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/naomie-harris/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Mahershala Ali
          </a>
          and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/naomie-harris/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Naomie Harris
          </a>
          are impeccable in supporting roles, with
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/trevante-rhodes/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Trevante Rhodes
          </a>
          and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/andre-holland/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Andre Holland
          </a>
          delivering an unforgettable final act.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/moonlight-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Moonlight.
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-21">
         </div>
        </div>

       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-42">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Guardians Of The Galaxy" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/8ec4/f590/5e32/6e06/4844/IMG_0258.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>

         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">

          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Marvel took one of its biggest swings with this space-borne adventure, which featured the MCU's freakiest and least-known characters (a talking raccoon, a walking tree, a green assassin lady, a muscleman named after a Bond villain and Star-who!?), starred that schlubby fellah from
          <em>
           Parks And Rec
          </em>
          , and was directed by the guy who turned
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/michael-rooker/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Michael Rooker
          </a>
          into a giant slug-monster in
          <em>
           Slither
          </em>
          . Which is pretty cool, when you think about it.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/guardians-galaxy-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Guardians Of The Galaxy
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-43">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Blade Runner 2049" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/8f87/5165/4308/8e3b/7afa/57%20Blade%20Runner%202049.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          44
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Putting together the director of
          <em>
           Arrival
          </em>
          with a sci-fi franchise that � for box office performance reasons � hasn't been overexploited the way some others have, seemed like a no-brainer. It's actually a big brainer, with
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/denis-villeneuve/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Denis Villeneuve
          </a>
          dipping into
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/philip-k-dick/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Philip K. Dick'
          </a>
          s universe and constructing a sequel that not only doesn't embarrass
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/ridley-scott/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Ridley Scott
          </a>
          's original, but builds out that world, adding layers and texture while still feeling of a piece. Audiences still didn't exactly bite, but between
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/harrison-ford/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Harrison Ford
          </a>
          revisiting his iconic replicant hunter and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/ryan-gosling/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Ryan Gosling
          </a>
          grappling with his own identity,
          <em>
           2049
          </em>
          is a triumph of quiet character moments and glorious, sense-enveloping spectacle.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/blade-runner-2049-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Blade Runner 2049
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-22">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-44">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Social Network" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/90b2/5165/438b/fe3b/7b01/56%20the%20social%20network.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          45
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Or, I'm Gonna Git You Zuckerberg. Portrayed as an �ber-ruthless ultra-nerd by
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/jesse-eisenberg/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Jesse Eisenberg
          </a>
          , it's fair to say the Facebook founder came out of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/david-fincher/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           David Fincher
          </a>
          's social-media drama smelling less of roses than the stuff you grow them in. But it is great drama, expertly wrought by screenwriter
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/aaron-sorkin/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Aaron Sorkin
          </a>
          , who exploits the story's central paradox (a guy who doesn't get people makes a fortune getting people together online) to supremely juicy effect.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/social-network-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Social Network
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-45">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Taxi Driver" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/911c/5909/d06a/1a4c/87c6/55%20Taxi%20Driver.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          46
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/martin-scorsese/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Martin Scorsese
          </a>
          and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/paul-schrader/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Paul Schrader
          </a>
          's gripping portrayal of a mentally crumbling Vietnam vet (
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/robert-de-niro/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Robert De Niro
          </a>
          's Travis Bickle) who ultimately figures the only way to wash the crime-caked streets of New York is with a nice, big bloodbath. Everyone here's at the top of their game: Scorsese, Schrader, De Niro, 14-year-old
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/jodie-foster/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Jodie Foster
          </a>
          and composer
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/bernard-herrmann/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Bernard Herrmann
          </a>
          . Yes, it's still talkin' to us.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/taxi-driver-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Taxi Driver
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-23">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-46">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Saving Private Ryan" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/9201/3ebe/4763/8b9c/e33b/54%20saving%20private%20ryan.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          47
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          The sheer bludgeoning, blood-spilling, visceral power of its Omaha Beach, D-Day-landing opening act ensured that
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/steven-spielberg/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Steven Spielberg
          </a>
          's fourth World War II movie set the standard for all future battle depictions. Its shaky-staccato-desaturated style (courtesy of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/janusz-kaminski/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Janusz Kaminski
          </a>
          's ingenious cinematography) newsreel made cinema has been oft-copied, but rarely bettered.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/saving-private-ryan-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Saving Private Ryan
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-47">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-590998486 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Forrest Gump" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/9291/5165/4384/c73b/7b1b/53%20Forrest%20Gump.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          48
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/robert-zemeckis/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Robert Zemeckis
          </a>
          ' affable stroll through some of America's most turbulent decades, as seen through the childlike eyes of the simple-but-successful Forrest � the role which earned
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/tom-hanks/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Tom Hanks
          </a>
          his second Oscar in two years. And it says a lot about the film's emotional heft that it managed to win an Oscar itself, when it was in competition with both
          <em>
           Pulp Fiction
          </em>
          and
          <em>
           The Shawshank Redemption
          </em>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/forrest-gump-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Forrest Gump
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-24">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-48">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Point Break" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/9334/f590/5e93/9206/4860/52%20Point%20Break.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          49
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          "Ever fired your gun in the air and gone 'Ahhhh?'" PC Danny Butterman's well-placed reference in
          <em>
           Hot Fuzz
          </em>
          confirmed, if confirmation were ever needed, that
          <em>
           Point Break
          </em>
          is a fundamental pillar of '90s pop culture cool, and one of the most memorable action blockbusters ever made. In
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/keanu-reeves/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Keanu Reeves
          </a>
          and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/patrick-swayze/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Patrick Swayze
          </a>
          , we get two smouldering sides of the same anti-heroic coin; in W. Peter Iliff's screenplay, we get gems of dialogue like "The correct term is 'babes', sir"; and in
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/kathryn-bigelow/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Kathryn Bigelow
          </a>
          's frenetic, confident direction, we get intense foot chases, fiery shoot-outs, epic surfing, and a spot of light skydiving. It shouldn't work: extreme sports, bank robberies
          <em>
           and
          </em>
          male bonding? But it does, every time.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/point-break-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Point Break
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-49">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">

            <img alt="Whiplash" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/93fa/f590/5e39/9506/4868/51%20Whiplash.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>

        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          If
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/damien-chazelle/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Damien Chazelle
          </a>
          's semi-autobiographical drama taught us anything, it's that jazz drumming is more hazardous to learn than base jumping. Especially when your mentor is
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/jk-simmons/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           J.K. Simmons
          </a>
          ' monstrous Fletcher: a raging bully who makes army drill instructors look like Care Bears. Though, of course, you could always argue that Fletcher's methods certainly got great results out of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/miles-teller/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Miles Teller
          </a>
          's battered but triumphant Andrew...
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/whiplash-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Whiplash
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>

          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">

       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-50">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">

            <img alt="Vertigo" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/9502/f590/5e19/4d06/4874/50%20VERTIGO.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
