         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          51
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          If
          <em>
           Psycho
          </em>
          was
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/alfred-hitchcock/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Hitchcock
          </a>
          's big shocker, then
          <em>
           Vertigo
          </em>
          is the one that gets properly under your skin. With
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/james-stewart/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           James Stewart
          </a>
          's detective stalking Kim Novak's mysterious woman, witnessing her suicide, then becoming obsessed with her double, it's certainly disturbing and most definitely (as the title suggests) disorientating. In the most artful and inventive way.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/vertigo-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Vertigo
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-51">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Spirited Away" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/96cd/3ebe/47b1/8d9c/e366/49%20Spririted%20Away.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          52
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          For a Western world raised on Disney movies,
          <em>
           Spirited Away
          </em>
          was a bracing change of pace � pure, uncut Studio Ghibli. Taking in bathhouses, spirits of Shinto folklore, and morality without clear-cut distinctions of good and evil,
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/hayao-miyazaki/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Hayao Miyazaki
          </a>
          's major crossover hit is distinctly Japanese. It's the film that brought Studio Ghibli � and anime at large � to mainstream Western audiences, an influence increasingly felt in the likes of
          <em>
           Moana
          </em>
          and
          <em>
           Frozen II
          </em>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/spirited-away-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Spirited Away
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-26">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-52">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Ghostbusters" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/9760/f590/5ec3/4206/488d/48%20Ghostbusters.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          53
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          As high-concept comedies go,
          <em>
           Ghostbusters
          </em>
          is positively stratospheric: a story of demonic incursion... with gags! And it manages to wring a fantastic supernatural adventure out of that concept, while never neglecting the opportunity to deliver a great laugh; or, on the flipside, ever allowing the zaniness to swallow up plot coherence. Ray Parker Jr was right. Bustin' did indeed make us feel good.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/ghostbusters-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Ghostbusters
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-53">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Do The Right Thing" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/97c2/f590/5e65/9506/4892/47%20Do%20The%20Right%20THing.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          54
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/spike-lee/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Spike Lee
          </a>
          had already caused a stir with his first two films �
          <em>
           She's Gotta Have It
          </em>
          and
          <em>
           School Daze
          </em>
          � but this was the one that changed everything, with Lee at full pelt, fully formed, in full command and full of fury. Over the longest, hottest summer's day in Brooklyn's Bed-Stuy, already boiling tensions between the African-Americans on the block and the Italian-Americans running a pizzeria eventually peak, erupting into violence. It's an absolutely flawless, funny, frightening piece of work, rammed with soon-to-be iconography from start to finish. It hasn't dated a day.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/right-thing-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Do The Right Thing
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-27">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-54">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Schindler's List" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/9866/f590/5e19/e406/4898/46%20schindler's%20list.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          55
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Spielberg's masterpiece, hands down. You might say the shark looks fakey in Jaws. You may wonder how Indy clung to the German sub in Raiders. But there's no flaws to be found in his harrowing, (mostly) monochromatic depiction of Nazi persecution of the Jewish community in Krakow. Unless you're the kind of shallow person who only watches movies that are 'entertaining'. In which case, you're missing out.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/schindler-list-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Schindler's List
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-55">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-1873904412 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Big Lebowaki" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/98da/dbee/af5c/b168/ffb2/45%20~the%20Big%20Lebowski.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          56
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          You've got to hand it to the Coen brothers. Not only did they make arguably the funniest movie of the '90s � which has since spawned a genuine film cult � they also managed to construct a kidnap mystery in which the detective isn't a detective and nobody was actually kidnapped. With bowling, marmots and a urine-stained rug.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/big-lebowski-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Big Lebowski
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-28">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-56">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-2560053711 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="It's A Wonderful" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/998c/dbee/af63/e468/ffb9/44%20it's%20a%20wonderful%20life.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          57
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Frank Capra's Christmas fantasy was the movie that coaxed a war-battered
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/james-stewart/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           James Stewart
          </a>
          back to acting, and a good thing, too: as George Bailey, who's shown a mind-blowing parallel reality in which he never existed, Stewart was never more appealing. And he tempers any potential schmaltz, too, with a sense of underlying world-weariness � one that he no doubt brought back from the conflict in Europe.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/wonderful-life-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of It's A Wonderful Life
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-57">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="There Will Be Blood" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/9a3d/dbee/afd9/ba68/ffbf/43%20There%20Will%20Be%20Blood.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          58
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          If America were a person, then oil man Daniel Plainview (
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/daniel-day-lewis/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Daniel Day-Lewis
          </a>
          ) is a vampire. (A milkshake-drinking vampire, if you feel like mixing our metaphor with his own.) Which is why it's appropriate that
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/paul-thomas-anderson/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Paul Thomas Anderson
          </a>
          gives the film a bit of a horror-movie vibe throughout and Day-Lewis delivers such a deliciously monstrous performance... right up to the point where he spills literal blood in an empty mansion, haunted only by himself.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/will-blood-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of There Will Be Blood
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-29">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-58">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="12 Angry Men" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/9aee/dbee/af39/3368/ffcb/42%2012%20Angry%20Men.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          59
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Juries most often amount to little more than set dressing in courtroom dramas. But
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/sidney-lumet/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Sidney Lumet
          </a>
          's film finds all its drama outside the courtroom itself and inside a jury deliberation room packed with fantastic character actors, who are forced to re-examine a seemingly straightforward case by lone-voice juror Henry Fonda. It's all about the value of looking at things differently, and a reminder that nothing is more important than great dialogue.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/twelve-angry-men-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of 12 Angry Men
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-59">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Silence Of The Lambs" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/9b60/5909/d020/b74c/8816/41%20Silence%20of%20the%20lambs.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          60
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Not only the first horror to win a Best Picture Oscar, it's also only the third movie to score in all four main categories: Picture, Director (the late, great
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/jonathan-demme/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Jonathan Demme
          </a>
          ), Actress (
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/jodie-foster/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Jodie Foster
          </a>
          ) and Actor (
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/anthony-hopkins/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Anthony Hopkins
          </a>
          ) � the latter managing that despite technically being a supporting performer, with a mere 25-ish minutes of screen time. Even so, it feels like Foster's movie more than anybody's: her vulnerable-but-steely Clarice Starling is defined by her ability, not her gender.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/silence-lambs-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Silence Of The Lambs
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-30">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-60">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Citizen Kane" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/9c19/5165/4386/2f3b/7b61/40%20Citizen%20kane.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          61
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/orson-welles/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Orson Welles
          </a>
          ' game-changing fictional biopic, that managed to both launch his film career and ruin it at the same time (turns out it's not a good idea to piss off powerful newspaper magnates by viciously satirising them to a mass audience). Not only did he use impressive new film-making techniques that make it feel like a movie far younger than its 76 years, but its power-corrupts story still resonates loudly. Now more than ever, in fact.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/citizen-kane-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Citizen Kane
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-61">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Gladiator" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/a127/dbee/af31/5c68/ffff/39%20Gladiator.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          62
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/ridley-scott/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Ridley Scott
          </a>
          's comeback (after a bad run with 1492, White Squall and G.I. Jane).
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/russell-crowe/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Russell Crowe'
          </a>
          s big Hollywood breakthrough. And, thanks to the scope of Scott's visual ambition combined with a leap forward in CGI quality, the movie that showed the industry you could make colossal historical epics commercially viable once more. Yes, we were entertained.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/gladiator-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Gladiator
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-31">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-62">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Good, The Bad And The Ugly" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/a1d4/3ebe/47dd/d89c/e3ce/38%20the%20good%20the%20bad%20and%20the%20ugly.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          63
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Sergio Leone sets three renegades against each other in a treasure hunt backdropped against the chaos and madness of the American Civil War. The result is the movie on his CV which best balances art and entertainment.
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/clint-eastwood/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Clint Eastwood
          </a>
          and Lee Van Cleef are great value as Blondie and Angel Eyes, but it's Eli Wallach's Tuco who steals this Wild West show: "When you have to shoot, shoot. Don't talk."
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/good-bad-ugly-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Good, The Bad And The Ugly
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-63">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Se7en" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/a2b0/f590/5e90/2c06/48e9/37%20Se7en.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          64
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Aka
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/david-fincher/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           David Fincher
          </a>
          's second debut movie. What sounded like a daft, novelty serial-killer thriller turned out to be a deeply rattling proper-shocker, which had the guts to throw down its biggest narrative twist halfway through, as warped murderer-moralist John Doe gives himself up. A twist made all the more effective thanks to
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/kevin-spacey/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Kevin Spacey
          </a>
          's insistence he wasn't billed until the end credits.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/seven-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Seven
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-32">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-64">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Eternal Sunshine Of The Spotless Mind" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/a401/5909/d056/5f4c/884e/36%20Eternal%20Sunshine.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          65
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Director
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/michel-gondry/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Michel Gondry
          </a>
          and screenwriter
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/charlie-kaufman/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Charlie Kaufman
          </a>
          deconstruct the relationship drama via a fantastic psycho-sci-fi device, as
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/jim-carrey/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Jim Carrey
          </a>
          's Joel races through his own mind to reverse a process by which all his memories of his failed relationship with
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/kate-winslet/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Kate Winslet
          </a>
          's Clementine are to be erased. Which is a brilliantly weird, round-the-houses way of reminding us that heartbreak should be valued as one of the things that makes us. Better to have loved and lost, and all that.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/eternal-sunshine-spotless-mind-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Eternal Sunshine Of The Spotless Mind
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-65">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Shining" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/a62c/f590/5e4e/8606/4906/35%20shining.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          66
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/stanley-kubrick/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Stanley Kubrick
          </a>
          's elegant adaptation of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/stephen-king/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Stephen King
          </a>
          's haunted-hotel story, starring a wonderfully deranged
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/jack-nicholson/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Jack Nicholso
          </a>
          n, is often cited as The Scariest Horror Movie Ever Made (perhaps tied with
          <em>
           The Exorcist
          </em>
          ), but it's also the Least Suitable Movie To Watch On Father's Day Ever. Unless you're the kind of Dad who thinks obsessively typing the same sentence over and over then chasing after your wife and kid with an axe constitutes good parenting.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/shining-2-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Shining
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-33">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-66">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Lord Of The Rings: The Two Towers" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/ac02/dbee/af63/3369/005b/34%20two%20towers.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          67
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Aside from Boromir, Aragorn and the small-town denizens of Bree, there's not a huge amount of human representation in
          <em>
           The Fellowship Of The Ring
          </em>
          . So one of the pleasures of
          <em>
           The Two Towers
          </em>
          is seeing Middle-earth truly open out after the arrival at Rohan, where the series takes on more of a sweeping, Nordic feel... Building up, of course, to Helm's Deep, a ferocious action crescendo which features gratuitous scenes of dwarf-tossing.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/lord-rings-two-towers-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Two Towers
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-67">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Casablanca" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/ac59/5165/434b/4c3b/7bdf/33%20Casablanca.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          68
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          When you've got such a clear-cut good-vs-evil scenario as World War II, it takes guts to put out a film which lets its (anti-) hero lurk for so long in a grey area of that conflict � while said War was still raging, no less. Of course, Rick (
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/humphrey-bogart/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Humphrey Bogart
          </a>
          ) eventually does the right thing, but watching him make both the Resistance and the Nazis squirm right up to the final scene is truly joyous.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/casablanca-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Casablanca
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-34">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-68">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Thing" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/ad03/5909/d018/5b4c/889e/32%20The%20Thing.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          69
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Any argument about whether or not modern remakes can ever be better than the 'classic' originals should be ended pretty quickly by mentioning this movie. With the help of SFX genius
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/rob-bottin/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Rob Bottin
          </a>
          ,
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/john-carpenter/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           John Carpenter
          </a>
          took the bones of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/howard-hawks/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Howard Hawks
          </a>
          ' 1951
          <em>
           The Thing From Another World
          </em>
          and crafted an intense, frosty sci-fi thriller featuring Hollywood's ultimate movie monster: one that could be any of us at any time, before contorting into a genuine biological nightmare.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/thing-2-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Thing
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-69">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">

            <img alt="Interstellar" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/adf6/5165/4363/823b/7bf0/31%20Interstellar.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>

         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          70
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->

         </span>

        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/christopher-nolan/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Christopher Nolan
          </a>
          's tribute to
          <em>
           2001
          </em>
          and
          <em>
           The Right Stuff
          </em>
          (with a little added
          <em>
           The Black Hole
          </em>
          ) presents long-distance space travel as realistically as it's possible to with the theoretical physics currently available. From the effects of gravity to the emotional implication of time dilation, it mixes science and sentiment to great effect. And it has a sarcastic robot, too.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/interstellar-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Interstellar
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">

       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-70">

           </picture>

         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          71
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/michael-mann/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Michael Mann
          </a>
          's starry upgrade of his TV movie
          <em>
           LA Takedown
          </em>
          squeezed every last drop of icon-juice out of its heavyweight double-billing, bringing
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/al-pacino/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Pacino
          </a>
          and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/robert-de-niro/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           De Niro
          </a>
          together on screen, sharing scenes for the very first time. The trick was to only do it twice during the entire running time, with that first diner meeting virtually fizzing with alpha-star electricity.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/heat-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Heat
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>

           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>

       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-71">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3689726306 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Apocalypse Now" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/aefa/f590/5ecf/da06/493e/29%20Apocalypse%20Now.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          72
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          The film-maker go-to movie du jour.
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/gareth-edwards/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Gareth Edwards
          </a>
          cited
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/francis-ford-coppola/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Coppola
          </a>
          's vivid and visceral jungle trek as a major influence on
          <em>
           Rogue One
          </em>
          ;
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/jordan-vogt-roberts/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Jordan Vogt-Roberts
          </a>
          drew from it extensively for
          <em>
           Kong: Skull Island
          </em>
          , and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/matt-reeves/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Matt Reeves
          </a>
          sees
          <em>
           War For The Planet Of The Apes
          </em>
          as his own simian-related tribute. Hardly surprising; it's both a visually rich war movie and also a powerfully resonant journey into the darkest recesses of the human soul.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/apocalypse-now-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Apocalypse Now
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>

       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-72">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">

          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Indiana Jones And The Last Crusade" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/afcb/5909/d038/5d4c/88b3/28%20Last%20Crusade.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          73
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          You voted... wisely. There may only be 12 years' difference between
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/harrison-ford/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Harrison Ford
          </a>
          and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/sean-connery/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Sean Connery
          </a>
          , but it's hard to imagine two better actors to play a bickering father and son, off on a globetrotting, Nazi-bashing, mythical mystery tour. After all, you've got
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/steven-spielberg/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Spielberg
          </a>
          /
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/george-lucas/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Lucas
          </a>
          ' own version of James Bond... And the original Bond himself.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/indiana-jones-last-crusade-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Indiana Jones And The Last Crusade
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-73">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Lord Of The Rings The Return Of The King" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b0b1/f590/5e55/dc06/4949/27%20Return%20of%20the%20king.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          74
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Anyone who bangs on about all those endings is missing the many joys of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/peter-jackson/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Peter Jackson
          </a>
          's Academy Award-laden trilogy-closer. It has some of the most colossal and entertaining battle scenes ever mounted; it has an awesome giant spider; it has that fantastic dramatic-ironic twist when Gollum saves the day through his own treachery; and it has that bit where Eowyn says, "I am no man". Deserves. Every. Oscar.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/lord-rings-return-king-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Return Of The King
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-37">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-74">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3276980844 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Die Hard" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b12e/5165/43e6/133b/7c10/26%20Die%20hard.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          75
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          One man using only his wits and whatever he can extract from his environment. A gang of bad guys terrorising the locals. If Die Hard wasn't set in a skyscraper during the 1980s, it could easily be a Western. A Western which, in the form of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/bruce-willis/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Bruce Willis
          </a>
          , not only convinced the world a TV-comedy star could be an action-hero, but also gave us one of our most seethingly charismatic big-screen villain-players:
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/alan-rickman/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Alan Rickman
          </a>
          .
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/die-hard-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Die Hard
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-75">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-2544340929 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Fight Club" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b191/5909/d009/314c/88c0/25%20Fight%20Club.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          76
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          After all the pre-release hype about how dark and brutal
          <em>
           Fight Club
          </em>
          was, one of the most surprising things to discover on seeing it was just how funny it actually was. And just as well; if you weren't laughing at Bob's "bitch-tits" or Tyler Durden's human-fat soap-making antics, it would be pretty hard to process
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/david-fincher/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           David Fincher
          </a>
          's bravura take on
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/chuck-palahniuk/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Chuck Palahniuk
          </a>
          's tale of modern masculinity running insanely rampant.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/fight-club-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Fight Club
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>

       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-76">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Terminator 2 Judgment Day" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b23f/5165/4381/e83b/7c20/24%20T2.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>

         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          77
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>

        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Making
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/arnold-schwarzenegger/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Arnie'
          </a>
          s T-800 a protector rather than killer for part two could have been a shark-jump moment for the
          <em>
           Terminator
          </em>
          series, but we're talking about
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/james-cameron/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           James Cameron
          </a>
          here. So it paid off � especially as this Terminator was just as much a student in human behaviour (with John Connor his teacher) as guardian, with some darkly comical results ("He'll live"). Is it really better than the original? In terms of scale and sheer, balls-out action spectacle, yes.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/terminator-2-judgment-day-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Terminator 2: Judgment Day
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">

       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-77">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">

            <img alt="2001: A Space Odyssey" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b2ce/f590/5e90/7e06/495f/23%202001.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>

          of

        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          You've voted it your favourite
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/stanley-kubrick/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Kubrick
          </a>
          movie, which makes sense to us. It is arguably his greatest gift to cinema, an infinitely ambitious vision of a space-faring future whose narrative centres on the most pivotal moment in human evolution since some ape-man first bashed another ape-man with an old bone. Graceful, gorgeous, unwearied by time's passing. Rather like that monolith.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/2001-space-odyssey-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of 2001: A Space Odyssey
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">

       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-39">

       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-78">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-362608305 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Avengers: Endgame" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b34d/f590/5eee/8e06/4963/22%20Endgame.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          79
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          What does it take to dethrone
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/james-cameron/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           James Cameron
          </a>
          ? A blockbuster of behemothic proportions. The weight of expectations on
          <em>
           Endgame
          </em>
          � the culmination of 11 years of interweaving stories, following up the greatest cinematic cliffhanger since
          <em>
           The Empire Strikes Back
          </em>
          � was immense, which only makes it more miraculous that the Russo Brothers (and writers
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/christopher-markus/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Christopher Markus
          </a>
          &amp; Stephen McFeeley) delivered a thrilling, adventurous, emotional time-travelling trip through the entire MCU so far. The character pay-offs are just as staggering as the action � and when Steve Rogers finally proved worthy enough to lift Mjolnir, a stone-cold cultural moment was created.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/avengers-endgame-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Avengers: Endgame
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-79">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Alien" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b4d1/5909/d003/124c/88d5/21%20Alien.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          80
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          On the one hand, re-watching
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/ridley-scott/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Ridley Scott'
          </a>
          s deep-space monster-slasher (and it's a movie which can handle as many re-watches as you can throw at it) makes you appreciate why he keeps coming back to that universe: it's so intoxicatingly atmospheric and deeply compelling, it sticks to you like a parasite. On the other hand, it really does make you wonder why he feels the need to keep tinkering with new cuts. After all, he got it perfectly right the first time around.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/alien-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Alien
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">

       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-80">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">

            <img alt="The Matrix" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b52d/5909/d0c1/974c/88da/20%20The%20Matrix.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>

         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          81
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          How two sibling indie film-makers with only a slick, sexy little crime film to their name (
          <em>
           Bound
          </em>
          ) created their own blockbuster sci-fi franchise. And opened up western audiences to the truth that kung-fu acrobatics are so much more fun than watching American or European muscle-men waving guns around. While also making everyone examine some fundamental philosophical questions about reality. Thanks to the Wachowskis, we all took the red pill, and we've never regretted it.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/matrix-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Matrix
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">

          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>

       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-81">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Inception" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b56d/3ebe/473b/3c9c/e466/19%20Inception.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>

         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          82
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Will
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/christopher-nolan/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Christopher Nolan
          </a>
          ever make a Bond movie? Well, with Inception he kind of already has. Except, instead of a British secret agent, we get a freelance corporate dream-thief. And the big climactic action sequence is so huge it takes up almost half the movie and is actually three big action sequences temporally nested inside each other around a surreal, metaphysical-conflict core.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/inception-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Inception
          </a>
         </p>

        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-41">

       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-82">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-4208164952 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Parasite" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b5e4/f590/5e2c/2106/4978/18%20parasite.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          83
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Few award ceremony moments stick in the mind more than
          <em>
           Parasite
          </em>
          taking the Best Picture gong at the Oscars in 2020. It's no surprise that it made history as the first non-English language movie to do so � this South Korean genre-defying delight offers some of the biggest twists and expertly mounted tension in recent memory, with a family of excellent performances from
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/song-kang-ho/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Song Kang-ho
          </a>
          , Park So-dam, Choi Woo-shik and more. Bitingly satirical, darkly comedic and made with unmatched precision,
          <em>
           Parasite
          </em>
          doesn't just overcome the 'one inch barrier' of subtitles, as referenced in director
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/bong-joon-ho/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Bong Joon-ho
          </a>
          's acceptance speech � it obliterates it entirely.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/parasite/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_self">
           Read Empire's review of Parasite
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-83">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Aliens" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b6c6/5909/d0f9/124c/88e8/17%20Aliens.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          84
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          The genius of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/james-cameron/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           James Cameron
          </a>
          's self-penned
          <em>
           Alien
          </em>
          follow-up was to not try to top the original as one of the greatest ever horror movies. Instead, he transplanted the Alien (and, significantly, Ripley) to a different genre, and created one of the greatest ever action movies. That's also a Vietnam metaphor. And also one of the most enduringly quotable films.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/aliens-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Aliens
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>

         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">

            <img alt="Blade Runner" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b706/5165/4356/fc3b/7c4c/16%20Blade%20Runner.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>

         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          85
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Rain-lashed, noodle-bar-packed streets shrouded in perpetual night, with giant adverts and neon signs doing the job you'd usually expect of the sun itself... The not-too-distant future had never looked cooler than in
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/ridley-scott/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Ridley Scott
          </a>
          's sci-fi gumshoe noir, and we're not sure it ever will.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/blade-runner-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Blade Runner
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-85">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Jurassic Park" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b770/5165/430f/dc3b/7c52/15%20Jurassic%20Park.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          86
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          When dinosaurs first ruled the movie-Earth, they did so in a herky-jerky stop-motion manner that while charmingly effective, required a fair dose of disbelief-suspension. When
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/steven-spielberg/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Steven Spielberg
          </a>
          brought them back on Isla Nublar, we felt for the first time they could be real, breathing animals (as opposed to monsters). And that's as much thanks to
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/stan-winston/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Stan Winston
          </a>
          's astonishing animatronics work as to ILM's groundbreaking CGI.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/jurassic-park-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Jurassic Park
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
