         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-43">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-86">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Godfather Part II" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b89c/dbee/afac/6469/00c1/14%20Godfather%202.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          87
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Often cited as the greatest-ever sequel,
          <em>
           TGPII
          </em>
          , as no-one's ever called it, is more accurately described as a seprequel. In a narrative masterstroke, it parallels Michael's (
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/al-pacino/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Al Pacino
          </a>
          ) consolidation of power with the ascendance of his Dad, Vito (
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/robert-de-niro/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Robert De Niro
          </a>
          ); the triumph of one paving the way to the utter corruption of the other.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/godfather-part-ii-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Godfather Part II
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-87">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-434239665 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Back To The Future" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b942/3ebe/473a/489c/e486/13%20BTTF.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          88
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Part science-fiction caper, part generational culture-clash movie, part weirdo family drama (in which the hero has to rescue his own existence after his mother falls in lust with him, eww),
          <em>
           Back To The Future
          </em>
          still manages to be timeless despite being so rooted in, well, time. And it might just have the best title of anything on this entire list.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/back-future-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Back To The Future
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-44">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-88">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Mad Max: Fury Road" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b97c/5165/43fb/d03b/7c65/12%20Fury%20Road.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          89
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          In which old dog
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/george-miller/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           George Miller
          </a>
          taught Hollywood some new tricks. Stripping the chase movie down to its raw essentials (the plot is basically: run away... then run back again!), Miller expertly built the narrative through some of the most astonishing and gloriously operatic action scenes we'd seen in yonks. While also ensuring his female characters are the film's strongest;
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/charlize-theron/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Charlize Theron
          </a>
          's Furiosa and Immortan Joe's ex-brides are inheriting a world "killed" by men...
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/mad-max-fury-road-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Mad Max: Fury Road
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-89">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Star Wars" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/b9f5/3ebe/477b/3f9c/e48a/11%20Star%20Wars.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          90
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/george-lucas/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           George Lucas
          </a>
          ' cocktail of fantasy, sci-fi, Western and World War II movie remains as culturally pervasive as ever. It's so mythically potent, you sense in time it could become a bona-fide religion...
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/star-wars-episode-iv-new-hope-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Star Wars
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-45">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-90">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Goodfellas" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/ba59/5165/43e0/333b/7c6f/10%20Goodfellas.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          91
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Where
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/francis-ford-coppola/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Coppola
          </a>
          embroiled us in the politics of the Mafia elite,
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/martin-scorsese/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Martin Scorsese
          </a>
          drew us into the treacherous but seductive world of the Mob's foot soldiers. And its honesty was as impactful as its sudden outbursts of (usually
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/joe-pesci/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Joe Pesci
          </a>
          -instigated) violence. Not merely via Henry Hill's (
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/ray-liotta/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Ray Liotta
          </a>
          ) narrative, but also Karen's (Lorraine Bracco) perspective: when Henry gives her a gun to hide, she admits, "It turned me on."
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/goodfellas-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Goodfellas
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-91">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Raiders Of The Lost Ark" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/bb13/f590/5e77/c706/49ac/9%20Raiders.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          92
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          In '81, it must have sounded like the ultimate pitch: the creator of
          <em>
           Star Wars
          </em>
          teams up with the director of
          <em>
           Jaws
          </em>
          to make a rip-roaring, Bond-style adventure starring the guy who played Han Solo, in which the bad guys are the evillest ever (the Nazis) and the MacGuffin is a big, gold box which unleashes the power of God. It still sounds like the ultimate pitch.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/raiders-lost-ark-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Raiders Of The Lost Ark
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-46">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-92">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Avengers: Infinity War" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/bb98/3ebe/4758/9d9c/e49e/8%20Infinity%20War.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          93
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          It was the biggest crossover event in cinematic history, and the biggest cliffhanger we never saw coming. After ten years and eighteen movies, Marvel took superhero filmmaking to a new level when they united all of Earth's mightiest heroes (and several more) against The Mad Titan himself � and incredibly, devastatingly, they lost.
          <em>
           Infinity War
          </em>
          crashed much-loved characters into each other's orbits, flitting between planets at breakneck speed as the Avengers desperately tried to stop Thanos from clicking his fingers and wiping out half the universe. Spectacular action, punch-the-air moments and big-scale battles are perfectly balanced, as all things should be, with hilarious interplays and aching emotion. Cinema doesn't get much bigger, or better, than this.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/avengers-infinity-war-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Avengers: Infinity War
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-93">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Pulp Fiction" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/bc1a/5909/d0f3/1e4c/890c/7%20Pulp%20Fiction.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          94
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          If
          <em>
           Reservoir Dogs
          </em>
          was a blood-spattered calling card,
          <em>
           Pulp Fiction
          </em>
          saw
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/quentin-tarantino/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Quentin Tarantino
          </a>
          kick our front door off its hinges � and then get applauded for doing it with such goddamn panache. It wore its numerous influences on its sleeve and yet felt utterly, invigoratingly fresh and new. We happy? Yeah, we happy.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/pulp-fiction-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Pulp Fiction
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-47">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-94">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Jaws" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/bc72/3ebe/47f1/829c/e4a1/6%20Jaws.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          95
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Forty-five years young, and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/steven-spielberg/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Spielberg
          </a>
          's breakthrough remains the touchstone for event-movie cinema. Not that any studio these days would dare put out a summer blockbuster that's half monster-on-the-rampage disaster, half guys-bonding-on-a-fishing-trip adventure. Maybe that's why it's never been rebooted. Or just because it's genuinely unsurpassable.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/jaws-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of Jaws
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-95">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Shawshank Redemption" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/bcdd/5165/4383/223b/7c83/5%20Shawshank.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          96
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          The warm, leathery embrace of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/morgan-freeman/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Morgan Freeman
          </a>
          's narration... The reassuringly
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/gary-cooper/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Gary Cooper
          </a>
          -ish rumple of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/tim-robbins/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Tim Robbins
          </a>
          ' face... Odd that a movie which features such harshness and tragedy should remain a feel-good perennial � even odder when you consider it was a box-office flop on release. Few directorial debuts are so deftly constructed; no surprise, then, that
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/frank-darabont/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Frank Darabont
          </a>
          has yet to top it.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/shawshank-redemption-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Shawshank Redemption
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>

           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Dark Knight" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/bd81/3ebe/47b5/fa9c/e4ac/4%20dark%20knight.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          97
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          Easily as influential on the genre as that other summer '08 comic-book movie,
          <em>
           Iron Man
          </em>
          ,
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/christopher-nolan/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Christopher Nolan
          </a>
          's
          <em>
           Batman Begins
          </em>
          sequel works wonders because he never saw it as a superhero film. It's closer to a
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/michael-mann/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Michael Mann
          </a>
          crime epic � except instead of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/al-pacino/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Pacino
          </a>
          and
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/robert-de-niro/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           De Niro
          </a>
          in a diner, you get a bloke dressed as a bat and a psychotic clown in a police interrogation room. With, er,
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/aaron-eckhart/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Aaron Eckhart
          </a>
          as
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/val-kilmer/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Val Kilmer
          </a>
          ...
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/dark-knight-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Dark Knight
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-97">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Godfather" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/be32/5165/433b/cc3b/7c8f/3%20Godfather.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          98
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/stanley-kubrick/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Stanley Kubrick
          </a>
          once described
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/francis-ford-coppola/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Francis Ford Coppola
          </a>
          's adaptation of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/mario-puzo/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Mario Puzo
          </a>
          's novel as the best film ever made � though having previously topped this list, this time it falls to bronze position. At once an art movie and a commercial blockbuster,
          <em>
           The Godfather
          </em>
          marked the dawn of the age of the mega-movie. An icon of the gangster genre, its imprinted in popular culture � "Luca Brasi sleeps with the fishes", the horse's head in the bed � but the first instalment of Brando's cotton-cheeked patriarch's fight for power is so much more than those moments. With performances, style and substance to savour, it's managed to both smash box office records and live on as a staple of cinematic canon.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/godfather-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Godfather
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-ad-wrapper">
        <div class="jsx-584588131">
         <div class="jsx-584588131 advert" id="inline-mpu-gallery-49">
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-98">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/bf59/3ebe/4721/a59c/e4be/2%20ESB.jpg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          99
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          The original "this one's darker" sequel, and by far the strongest of the saga. Not just because the baddies win (temporarily), or because it Force-slammed us with that twist ("No, I am your father"). Empire super-stardestroys thanks to the way it deepens the core relationships � none more effectively than Han and Leia's. She loves him. He knows. And it still hurts.
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/star-wars-episode-v-empire-strikes-back-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Empire Strikes Back
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
       <div class="jsx-3523802742 listicle-item" data-test="listicle-item-99">
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-image">
         <div class="jsx-3628565330 image-container">
          <div class="jsx-1901279781 image-loading">
          </div>
          <div class="lazyLoad">
           <picture class="jsx-2590794431">
            <source class="jsx-2590794431" media="(min-width:480px)" srcset=""/>
            <img alt="The Lord Of The Rings: The Fellowship Of The Ring" class="jsx-2590794431 loading" data-src="//images.bauerhosting.com/legacy/media/619d/bfe9/5909/d08f/544c/892d/1%20Fellowship.jpeg?q=80&amp;auto=format&amp;w=500" src="" title=""/>
           </picture>
          </div>
         </div>
         <span class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-count">
          100
          <!-- -->
          of
          <!-- -->
          100
         </span>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 listicle-item-content">
         <p>
          A wizard is never late. Nor is he early. He arrives precisely when he... well, you know the rest. It might have taken 20 years for
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/peter-jackson/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Peter Jackson
          </a>
          's plucky fantasy to clamber, Mount-Doom-style, to the very pinnacle of our greatest-movies pantheon. But here it is, brighter and more resplendent than ever.
          <em>
           The Fellowship Of The Ring
          </em>
          contains so much movie. Even at the halfway point, as the characters take a breather to bicker in Rivendell, you already feel sated, like you've experienced more thrills, more suspense, more jollity and ethereal beauty than a regular film could possibly muster up. But Jackson is only getting started. Onwards his adventure hustles, to the bravura dungeoneering of Khazad-dum, to the sinisterly serene glades of Lothlorien, to the final requiem for flawed Boromir amidst autumnal leaves. As
          <em>
           Fellowship
          </em>
          thrums to its conclusion, finally applying the brakes with a last swell of
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/people/howard-shore/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Howard Shore
          </a>
          's heavenly score, you're left feeling euphoric, bereft and hopeful, all at the same time.
          <em>
           The Two Towers
          </em>
          has the coolest battle.
          <em>
           The Return Of The King
          </em>
          boasts the most batshit, operatic spectacle. But Fellowship remains the most perfect of the three, matching every genius action beat with a soul-stirring emotional one, as its Middle-earth-traversing gang swells in size in the first act, then dwindles in the third. This oddball suicide squad has so much warmth and wit, they're not just believable as friends of each other � they've come to feel like they're our pals too.An ornately detailed masterwork with a huge, pulsing heart, it's just the right film for our times � full of craft, conviction and a belief that trudging forward, step by step, in dark days is the bravest act of all. Its ultimate heroes aren't the strongest, or those with the best one-liners, but the ones who just keep going. And so
          <em>
           Fellowship
          </em>
          endures: a miracle of storytelling, a feat of filmmaking and still the gold standard for cinematic experiences. Right, now that's decided, who's up for second breakfast?
         </p>
         <p>
          <a href="https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/lord-rings-fellowship-ring-review/" rel="noopener noreferrer" target="_blank">
           Read Empire's review of The Lord Of The Rings: The Fellowship Of The Ring
          </a>
         </p>
        </div>
        <div class="jsx-4245974604 bottom">
         <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-brand">
          <div class="jsx-4245974604 price-content">
          </div>
          <div class="jsx-4290002108 brand">
           <img alt="Amazon" class="jsx-4290002108 amazon-no-prime" src="data:image/png;base64,"/>
          </div>
         </div>
        </div>
       </div>
      </div>

        </a>

     </div>

Oh, and by the way: Nice Guy Eddie was shot by Mr. White. Who fired twice. And [Harold Ramis](https://www.empireonline.com/people/harold-ramis/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} (directing and co-writing with Danny Rubin) managing to find gold in the story of a man trapped in a time loop. It might not have been the first to tap this particular trope, but it's head and shoulders above the rest. Murray's snarktastic delivery makes the early going easy to laugh at, but as the movie finds deeper things to say about existence and morals, it never feels like a polemic.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Groundhog Day](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/groundhog-day-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Groundhog-Day-Blu-ray-Bill-Murray/dp/B001JI0IEU/ref=sr_1_3?keywords=groundhog+day\u0026amp;qid=1637701827\u0026amp;qsid=260-5470953-3477150\u0026amp;sr=8-3\u0026amp;sres=B00ET08Q8A%2CB00QMWKD20%2CB00005UL69%2CB002JF3FWE%2CB09234WQ34","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"53932","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"98) Paddington 2","fileName":"IMG_0300.JPG","path":"legacy/media/619d/590a/f590/5e6f/8a06/4673","width":1280,"height":720},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"98) Paddington 2","altText":"Paddington 2","credits":"","description":"When the first _Paddington_ was on the way, early trailers didn't look entirely promising. effective weapon than Mjolnir. _Ragnarok_, which shakes up Thor's entire world (by, er, destroying it) is a hilarious take on a superhero story, full of action, while re-introducing [Mark Ruffalo](https://www.empireonline.com/people/mark-ruffalo/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s Hulk in fantastic fashion and having us meet the likes of [Tessa noreferrer} to make not only turned out to be a hands-down masterpiece but also effectively invented a genre: the psycho-killer slasher movie. With its message that open-minded communication enables us to realise the things we have in common with those who appear vastly different, it feels like genuinely compulsive viewing for these troubled times.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Arrival](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/arrival-2-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B01MXEQRLW","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54009","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"75) A Quiet Place","fileName":"IMG_0275.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/8191/3ebe/4762/8f9c/e2aa","width":1500,"height":843},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"75) A Quiet Place","altText":"A Quiet Place","credits":"","description":"Take a simple concept (don't make a sound, or aliens will get you), a stellar cast ([Emily Blunt](https://www.empireonline.com/people/emily-blunt/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}, Millicent Simmonds, Noah Jupe) and a director with a laser-sharp vision ([John Krasinski](https://www.empireonline.com/people/john-krasinski/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}) and what do you get? As it turns out, one of the most innovative, refreshing, unbearably tense horror movies of the 21st century. From the second it starts, the imposed silence of _A Quiet Place_ makes it a revelatory cinematic experience � as the Abbott family pad gently around their home, the store, the woods, you feel in your bones that one wrong step equals disaster. The (loudly) ticking time bomb of imminent childbirth sets the scene for a stellar scary finale, but it's the deeply endearing family dynamic that sets this apart.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of A Quiet Place](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/quiet-place-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Quiet-Place-Blu-Ray-Region-Free/dp/B07BQMX35R","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54010","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"74) Trainspotting","fileName":"IMG_0274.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/825d/dbee/afae/3e68/feee","width":2060,"height":1159},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"74) Trainspotting","altText":"Trainspotting","credits":"","description":"For their follow up to the superb _Shallow Grave_, [Danny Boyle](https://www.empireonline.com/people/danny-boyle/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} (director), [Andrew Macdonald](https://www.empireonline.com/people/andrew-macdonald/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} (producer) and [John Hodge](https://www.empireonline.com/people/john-hodge/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} (screenwriter) foolhardily elected to film the supposedly unfilmable: [Irvine Welsh](https://www.empireonline.com/people/irvine-welsh/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s scrappy, episodic, multi-perspective novel about Edinburgh low-lives. [Alfred Hitchcock](https://www.empireonline.com/people/alfred-hitchcock/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} really knew how to take a corker of a premise and spin it into a peerless thriller (that's why they called him The Master Of Suspense), but _Rear Window_ also deserves praise for an astonishing set build: that entire Greenwich Village courtyard was constructed at Paramount Studios, complete with a drainage system that could handle all the rain.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Rear Window](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/rear-window-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00KQHWA9Q/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B00KQHWA9Q\u0026amp;linkId=20b30c86700e2ed33eaf047da4bbba0e","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54020","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"71) Up","fileName":"IMG_0271.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/84db/3ebe/47eb/e69c/e2c2","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"71) Up","altText":"Up","credits":"","description":"A lot has been said about the opening to [Pete Docter](https://www.empireonline.com/people/pete-docter/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s Pixar masterpiece, and rightly so, wringing tears from the hardest of hearts with a wordless sequence set to [Michael Giacchino](https://www.empireonline.com/people/michael-giacchino/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s lovely, Oscar-winning score that charts the ups and downs of a couple's marriage. Yet while the majority of the film is more of a straight-ahead adventure tale (albeit one with a wacky bird and talking dogs), that doesn't make it any less satisfying. And it says a lot about the film's emotional heft that it managed to win an Oscar itself, when it was in competition with both _Pulp Fiction_ and _The Shawshank Redemption_.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Forrest Gump](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/forrest-gump-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00C6CARIU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B00C6CARIU\u0026amp;linkId=1d63711853e1efb0901c2cfb700697be","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54086","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"52)  Point Break","fileName":"52 Point Break.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/9334/f590/5e93/9206/4860","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"52)  Point Break","altText":"Point Break","credits":"","description":"\"Ever fired your gun in the air and gone 'Ahhhh?'\" PC Danny Butterman's well-placed reference in _Hot Fuzz_ confirmed, if confirmation were ever needed, that _Point Break_ is a fundamental pillar of '90s pop culture cool, and one of the most memorable action blockbusters ever made. In [Keanu Reeves](https://www.empireonline.com/people/keanu-reeves/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} and [Patrick Swayze](https://www.empireonline.com/people/patrick-swayze/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}, we get two smouldering sides of the same anti-heroic coin; in W. Peter Iliff's screenplay, we get gems of dialogue like \"The correct term is 'babes', sir\"; and in [Kathryn Bigelow](https://www.empireonline.com/people/kathryn-bigelow/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s frenetic, confident direction, we get intense foot chases, fiery shoot-outs, epic surfing, and a spot of light skydiving. It shouldn't work: extreme sports, bank robberies _and_ male bonding? But it does, every time.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Point Break](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/point-break-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Point-Break-Blu-ray-Region-Free/dp/B004MW57HS/","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54090","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"51) Whiplash","fileName":"51 Whiplash.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/93fa/f590/5e39/9506/4868","width":3840,"height":2160},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"51) Whiplash","altText":"Whiplash","credits":"","description":"If [Damien Chazelle](https://www.empireonline.com/people/damien-chazelle/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s semi-autobiographical drama taught us anything, it's that jazz drumming is more hazardous to learn than base jumping. Especially when your mentor is [J.K. Simmons](https://www.empireonline.com/people/jk-simmons/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}' monstrous Fletcher: a raging bully who makes army drill instructors look like Care Bears. Though, of course, you could always argue that Fletcher's methods certainly got great results out of [Miles Teller](https://www.empireonline.com/people/miles-teller/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s battered but triumphant Andrew...\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Whiplash](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/whiplash-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00S6PLGHC/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B00S6PLGHC\u0026amp;linkId=44510cceb42b782b5dcbe15fd46714f0","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54091","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"50) Vertigo","fileName":"50 VERTIGO.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/9502/f590/5e19/4d06/4874","width":1280,"height":720},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"50) Vertigo","altText":"Vertigo","credits":"","description":"If _Psycho_ was [Hitchcock](https://www.empireonline.com/people/alfred-hitchcock/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s big shocker, then _Vertigo_ is the one that gets properly under your skin. With [James Stewart](https://www.empireonline.com/people/james-stewart/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s detective stalking Kim Novak's mysterious woman, witnessing her suicide, then becoming obsessed with her double, it's certainly disturbing and most definitely (as the title suggests) disorientating. In the most artful and inventive way.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Vertigo](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/vertigo-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B003BEDT96/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B003BEDT96\u0026amp;linkId=a52c85070deb4e8583914ad436b79644","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54095","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"49) Spirited Away","fileName":"49 Spririted Away.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/96cd/3ebe/47b1/8d9c/e366","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"49) Spirited Away","altText":"Spirited Away","credits":"","description":"For a Western world raised on Disney movies, _Spirited Away_ was a bracing change of pace � pure, uncut Studio Ghibli. Taking in bathhouses, spirits of Shinto folklore, and morality without clear-cut distinctions of good and evil, [Hayao Miyazaki](https://www.empireonline.com/people/hayao-miyazaki/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s major crossover hit is distinctly Japanese. It's the film that brought Studio Ghibli � and anime at large � to mainstream Western audiences, an influence increasingly felt in the likes of _Moana_ and _Frozen II_.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Spirited Away](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/spirited-away-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B00M482XCY/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;linkCode=ll1\u0026amp;tag=emparticle142-21\u0026amp;linkId=21d796958369a86a91e9953a4f6aaaf4","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54098","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"48) Ghostbusters","fileName":"48 Ghostbusters.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/9760/f590/5ec3/4206/488d","width":2048,"height":1152},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"48) Ghostbusters","altText":"Ghostbusters","credits":"","description":"As high-concept comedies go, _Ghostbusters_ is positively stratospheric: a story of demonic incursion... with gags! And it manages to wring a fantastic supernatural adventure out of that concept, while never neglecting the opportunity to deliver a great laugh; or, on the flipside, ever allowing the zaniness to swallow up plot coherence. Ray Parker Jr was right. Bustin' did indeed make us feel good.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Ghostbusters](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/ghostbusters-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00KWWFV2I/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B00KWWFV2I\u0026amp;linkId=70f2b79dcc0fae21b0e1d1e3ba2181e0","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54102","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"47) Do The Right Thing","fileName":"47 Do The Right THing.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/97c2/f590/5e65/9506/4892","width":1600,"height":900},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"47) Do The Right Thing","altText":"Do The Right Thing","credits":"","description":"[Spike Lee](https://www.empireonline.com/people/spike-lee/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} had already caused a stir with his first two films � _She's Gotta Have It_ and _School Daze_ � but this was the one that changed everything, with Lee at full pelt, fully formed, in full command and full of fury. Over the longest, hottest summer's day in Brooklyn's Bed-Stuy, already boiling tensions between the African-Americans on the block and the Italian-Americans running a pizzeria eventually peak, erupting into violence. It's an absolutely flawless, funny, frightening piece of work, rammed with soon-to-be iconography from start to finish. It hasn't dated a day.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Do The Right Thing](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/right-thing-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Right-Thing-Criterion-Collection-Blu-ray/dp/B07QLNWT8S","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54106","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"46) Schindler's List","fileName":"46 schindler's list.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/9866/f590/5e19/e406/4898","width":2560,"height":1440},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"46) Schindler's List","altText":"Schindler's List","credits":"","description":"Spielberg's masterpiece, hands down. You might say the shark looks fakey in Jaws. You may wonder how Indy clung to the German sub in Raiders. But there's no flaws to be found in his harrowing, (mostly) monochromatic depiction of Nazi persecution of the Jewish community in Krakow. Unless you're the kind of shallow person who only watches movies that are 'entertaining'. Unless you're the kind of Dad who thinks obsessively typing the same sentence over and over then chasing after your wife and kid with an axe constitutes good parenting.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Shining](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/shining-2-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B0013K11AE/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B0013K11AE\u0026amp;linkId=1750fdd19c3f5cb95b27a4912f39c241","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54148","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"34) The Lord Of The Rings: The Two Towers","fileName":"34 two towers.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/ac02/dbee/af63/3369/005b","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"34) The Lord Of The Rings: The Two Towers","altText":"The Lord Of The Rings: The Two Towers","credits":"","description":"Aside from Boromir, Aragorn and the small-town denizens of Bree, there's not a huge amount of human representation in _The Fellowship Of The Ring_. So one of the pleasures of _The Two Towers_ is seeing Middle-earth truly open out after the arrival at Rohan, where the series takes on more of a sweeping, Nordic feel... Building up, of course, to Helm's Deep, a ferocious action crescendo which features gratuitous scenes of dwarf-tossing.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Two Towers](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/lord-rings-two-towers-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00LTQPBE4/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B00LTQPBE4\u0026amp;linkId=b5ecd2459c4e97c10b48650d8a2688ab","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54152","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"33) Casablanca","fileName":"33 Casablanca.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/ac59/5165/434b/4c3b/7bdf","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"33) Casablanca","altText":"Casablanca","credits":"","description":"When you've got such a clear-cut good-vs-evil scenario as World War II, it takes guts to put out a film which lets its (anti-) hero lurk for so long in a grey area of that conflict � while said War was still raging, no less. And the big climactic action sequence is so huge it takes up almost half the movie and is actually three big action sequences temporally nested inside each other around a surreal, metaphysical-conflict core.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Inception](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/inception-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B005EYSVJE/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B005EYSVJE\u0026amp;linkId=d9c42eeb50965786e1888a28e2a86856","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54203","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"18) Parasite","fileName":"18 parasite.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/b5e4/f590/5e2c/2106/4978","width":1708,"height":961},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"18) Parasite","altText":"Parasite","credits":"","description":"Few award ceremony moments stick in the mind more than _Parasite_ taking the Best Picture gong at the Oscars in 2020. It's no surprise that it made history as the first non-English language movie to do so � this South Korean genre-defying delight offers some of the biggest twists and expertly mounted tension in recent memory, with a family of excellent performances from [Song Kang-ho](https://www.empireonline.com/people/song-kang-ho/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}, Park So-dam, Choi Woo-shik and more. Bitingly satirical, darkly comedic and made with unmatched precision, _Parasite_ doesn't just overcome the 'one inch barrier' of subtitles, as referenced in director [Bong Joon-ho](https://www.empireonline.com/people/bong-joon-ho/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s acceptance speech � it obliterates it entirely.\n\n  \n[Read Empire's review of Parasite](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/parasite/)","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Parasite-Blu-ray-Song-Kang-Ho/dp/B084LF7564","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54208","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"17) Aliens","fileName":"17 Aliens.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/b6c6/5909/d0f9/124c/88e8","width":3840,"height":2160},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"17) Aliens","altText":"Aliens","credits":"","description":"The genius of [James Cameron](https://www.empireonline.com/people/james-cameron/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s self-penned _Alien_ follow-up was to not try to top the original as one of the greatest ever horror movies. Instead, he transplanted the Alien (and, significantly, Ripley) to a different genre, and created one of the greatest ever action movies. That's also a Vietnam metaphor. And also one of the most enduringly quotable films.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Aliens](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/aliens-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B005NGOS7W/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B005NGOS7W\u0026amp;linkId=b8e89b3b81357755815f6a0dbce81c28","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54209","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"16) Blade Runner","fileName":"16 Blade Runner.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/b706/5165/4356/fc3b/7c4c","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"16) Blade Runner","altText":"Blade Runner","credits":"","description":"Rain-lashed, noodle-bar-packed streets shrouded in perpetual night, with giant adverts and neon signs doing the job you'd usually expect of the sun itself... After ten years and eighteen movies, Marvel took superhero filmmaking to a new level when they united all of Earth's mightiest heroes (and several more) against The Mad Titan himself � and incredibly, devastatingly, they lost. _Infinity War_ crashed much-loved characters into each other's orbits, flitting between planets at breakneck speed as the Avengers desperately tried to stop Thanos from clicking his fingers and wiping out half the universe. Spectacular action, punch-the-air moments and big-scale battles are perfectly balanced, as all things should be, with hilarious interplays and aching emotion. Cinema doesn't get much bigger, or better, than this.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Avengers: Infinity War](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/avengers-infinity-war-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Avengers-Infinity-War-DVD/dp/B07CNM5XS3","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54241","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"7) Pulp Fiction","fileName":"7 Pulp Fiction.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/bc1a/5909/d0f3/1e4c/890c","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"7) Pulp Fiction","altText":"Pulp Fiction","credits":"","description":"If _Reservoir Dogs_ was a blood-spattered calling card, _Pulp Fiction_ saw [Quentin Tarantino](https://www.empireonline.com/people/quentin-tarantino/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} kick our front door off its hinges � and then get applauded for doing it with such goddamn panache. At once an art movie and a commercial blockbuster, _The Godfather_ marked the dawn of the age of the mega-movie. An icon of the gangster genre, its imprinted in popular culture � \"Luca Brasi sleeps with the fishes\", the horse's head in the bed � but the first instalment of Brando's cotton-cheeked patriarch's fight for power is so much more than those moments. With performances, style and substance to savour, it's managed to both smash box office records and live on as a staple of cinematic canon.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Godfather](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/godfather-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Godfather-Blu-ray-Region-Free/dp/B004R0TV4K/?tag=emparticle102-2","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54256","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"2) Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back","fileName":"2 ESB.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/bf59/3ebe/4721/a59c/e4be","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"2) Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back","altText":"Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back","credits":"","description":"The original \"this one's darker\" sequel, and by far the strongest of the saga. Not just because the baddies win (temporarily), or because it Force-slammed us with that twist (\"No, I am your father\"). Empire super-stardestroys thanks to the way it deepens the core relationships � none more effectively than Han and Leia's. She loves him. He knows. And it still hurts.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Empire Strikes Back](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/star-wars-episode-v-empire-strikes-back-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B013GTXFIU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B013GTXFIU\u0026amp;linkId=67f20332ce9ce51279c06451a5d23ef8","price":null},{"__typename":"ImageMeta","id":"54261","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"1) The Lord Of The Rings: The Fellowship Of The Ring","fileName":"1 Fellowship.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/bfe9/5909/d08f/544c/892d","width":3200,"height":1800},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"1) The Lord Of The Rings: The Fellowship Of The Ring","altText":"The Lord Of The Rings: The Fellowship Of The Ring","credits":"","description":"A wizard is never late. Nor is he early. He arrives precisely when he... well, you know the rest. It might have taken 20 years for [Peter Jackson](https://www.empireonline.com/people/peter-jackson/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s plucky fantasy to clamber, Mount-Doom-style, to the very pinnacle of our greatest-movies pantheon. But here it is, brighter and more resplendent than ever._The Fellowship Of The Ring_ contains so much movie. Even at the halfway point, as the characters take a breather to bicker in Rivendell, you already feel sated, like you've experienced more thrills, more suspense, more jollity and ethereal beauty than a regular film could possibly muster up. But Jackson is only getting started. Onwards his adventure hustles, to the bravura dungeoneering of Khazad-dum, to the sinisterly serene glades of Lothlorien, to the final requiem for flawed Boromir amidst autumnal leaves. As _Fellowship_ thrums to its conclusion, finally applying the brakes with a last swell of [Howard Shore](https://www.empireonline.com/people/howard-shore/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s heavenly score, you're left feeling euphoric, bereft and hopeful, all at the same time. _The Two Towers_ has the coolest battle. _The Return Of The King_ boasts the most batshit, operatic spectacle. But Fellowship remains the most perfect of the three, matching every genius action beat with a soul-stirring emotional one, as its Middle-earth-traversing gang swells in size in the first act, then dwindles in the third. This oddball suicide squad has so much warmth and wit, they're not just believable as friends of each other � they've come to feel like they're our pals too.An ornately detailed masterwork with a huge, pulsing heart, it's just the right film for our times � full of craft, conviction and a belief that trudging forward, step by step, in dark days is the bravest act of all. Its ultimate heroes aren't the strongest, or those with the best one-liners, but the ones who just keep going. And so _Fellowship_ endures: a miracle of storytelling, a feat of filmmaking and still the gold standard for cinematic experiences. Right, now that's decided, who's up for second breakfast?\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Lord Of The Rings: The Fellowship Of The Ring](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/lord-rings-fellowship-ring-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener And [Harold Ramis](https://www.empireonline.com/people/harold-ramis/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} (directing and co-writing with Danny Rubin) managing to find gold in the story of a man trapped in a time loop. [Michael Cera](https://www.empireonline.com/people/michael-cera/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} is the put-upon protagonist, but it's Ramona's ([Mary Elizabeth Winstead](https://www.empireonline.com/people/mary-elizabeth-winstead/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}) seven deadly exes that set the screen alight, including [Chris Evans](https://www.empireonline.com/people/chris-evans/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} and [Brie Larson](https://www.empireonline.com/people/brie-larson/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} � before they were saving half the universe together. With masterful touches of magical realism and stunning shots that stick in the mind throughout, _Scott Pilgrim_ is one of Wright's most memorable.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Scott Pilgrim](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/scott-pilgrim-vs-world-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Pilgrim-Steelbook-Blu-ray-Digital-UltraViolet/dp/B00V5ZSSI0","price":null},"ImageMeta:53948":{"id":"53948","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"93) Portrait Of A Lady On Fire","fileName":"IMG_0295.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/5ddd/f590/5ef7/2c06/46a5","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"93) Portrait Of A Lady On Fire","altText":"Portrait Of A Lady On Fire","credits":"","description":"[Celine Sciamma](https://www.empireonline.com/people/celine-sciamma/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s magnetic, masterful lesbian romance may be a recent addition to this list, but became an instant landmark of queer cinema upon its release. Starring [Noumie Merlant](https://www.empireonline.com/people/noemie-merlant/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} as an 18th century painter and [Aduele Haenel](https://www.empireonline.com/people/adele-haenel/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} as her elusive subject, _Portrait Of A Lady On Fire_ is a tale of an epic love developed in the quietest, most delicate way, formed in stolen moments and glances. Sciamma's carefully constructed script is matched by Claire Mathon's cinematography, each shot like a Renaissance painting brought to life. Pure poetry.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Portrait Of A Lady On Fire](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/portrait-of-a-lady-on-fire/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Portrait-Lady-Blu-ray-Nou00e9mie-Merlant/dp/B0859R3D74","price":null},"ImageMeta:53950":{"id":"53950","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"92) L�on","fileName":"IMG_0294.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/5ed4/5165/4393/173b/793d","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"92) L�on","altText":"Lu00e9on","credits":"","description":"In some ways, [Luc Besson](https://www.empireonline.com/people/luc-besson/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s first English-language movie is a spiritual spin-off: after all, isn't [Jean Reno](https://www.empireonline.com/people/jean-reno/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s eponymous hitman just Nikita's Victor The Cleaner renamed and fleshed out? Set in a dark near-future world where an aging Logan is caring for a mentally unstable Professor Xavier ([Patrick Stewart](https://www.empireonline.com/people/patrick-stewart/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}) and getting mixed up yet again with some very dangerous people , _Logan_ is a truly original superhero tale that is mournful without being morbid. It's so outside the established mold, in fact, it's honestly a wonder the film ever got made.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Logan](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/logan-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Logan-Blu-ray-Hugh-Jackman/dp/B06X9CHD84","price":null},"ImageMeta:53959":{"id":"53959","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"90) The Terminator","fileName":"IMG_0292.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/72d1/5909/d00e/394c/86c8","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"90) The Terminator","altText":"The Terminator","credits":"","description":"It features time travel and a cyborg, with car chases and shoot-outs, but in [James Cameron](https://www.empireonline.com/people/james-cameron/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s first proper movie (ie. not featuring flying piranhas) it's all packed around the blood-covered endoskeleton of a relentless-killer horror pic. After all, what is [Arnold Schwarzenegger](https://www.empireonline.com/people/arnold-schwarzenegger/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s Uzi-9mm-toting Terminator, if not an upgraded version of _Halloween_'s Michael Myers?\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Terminator](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/terminator-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Terminator-Blu-ray-Arnold-Schwarzenegger/dp/B00W5C5AM4","price":null},"ImageMeta:53963":{"id":"53963","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"89) No Country For Old Men","fileName":"IMG_0291.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/73a4/dbee/afcc/7468/fe86","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"89) No Country For Old Men","altText":"No Country For Old Men","credits":"","description":"The Coen brothers' [Cormac McCarthy](https://www.empireonline.com/people/cormac-mccarthy/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} adaptation is a tension-ratcheting, 1980 Texas-set chase movie, which also thoughtfully considers the question: how can good people ever possibly deal with a world going to shit? It also revealed that [Javier Bardem](https://www.empireonline.com/people/javier-bardem/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} makes an awesome villain; ever since he played _No Country_'s cold-blooded assassin Anton Chigurh, Hollywood can't stop making him the bad guy.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of No Country For Old Men](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/country-old-men-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/No-Country-for-Old-Men/dp/B00E3PK7EM/ref=sr_1_2?crid=2J08ZWAGDTM8F\u0026amp;keywords=no+country+for+old+men+blu+ray\u0026amp;qid=1637840620\u0026amp;qsid=257-7683201-7591354\u0026amp;sprefix=no+country+for+old+men+b%2Caps%2C151\u0026amp;sr=8-2\u0026amp;sres=B01GWCITES%2CB00E3PK7EM%2CB00A1LGP66%2CB0839MBM2Y%2CB002HFWAYK%2CB00MNF7GH0%2CB0041KW1AW%2CB006OKESJY%2CB07QVMJX1L%2CB07SRF34B2%2CB09GPXXS8N%2CB01LCYVUSI%2CB0992TDR5H%2CB07KX7M153%2CB083VN2ZH1%2CB00JQ8HTRY","price":null},"ImageMeta:53964":{"id":"53964","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"88) Titanic","fileName":"IMG_0290.JPG","path":"legacy/media/619d/7484/3ebe/47c9/9c9c/e22c","width":1280,"height":720},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"88) Titanic","altText":"Titanic","credits":"","description":"[James Cameron](https://www.empireonline.com/people/james-cameron/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} doesn't do things by halves. His movie about the 1912 sinking of the world's biggest cruise liner was the most expensive ever made, suffered a difficult, overrunning shoot, and was predicted to be a career-ending flop. But it turned out to be one of the most successful films of all time (in terms of both box office and Awards), and made him King Of The World.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Titanic](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/titanic-2-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Titanic-Blu-ray-Region-Leonardo-DiCaprio/dp/B003AQCV0I","price":null},"ImageMeta:53968":{"id":"53968","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"87) The Exorcist","fileName":"IMG_0289.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/7584/3ebe/474f/b09c/e235","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"87) The Exorcist","altText":"The Exorcist","credits":"","description":"[William Friedkin](https://www.empireonline.com/people/william-friedkin/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s horror masterwork, in which a 12-year-old girl is possessed by a demon, has a reputation as a shocker (in the good sense), with the pea-soup vomit, head-spin and crucifix abuse moments the most regularly cited. But the reason it chills so deeply is the way it sustains and builds its disquieting atmosphere so craftily and consistently throughout.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Exorcist](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/exorcist-director-cut-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B003IHVKRY","price":null},"ImageMeta:53972":{"id":"53972","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"86) Black Panther","fileName":"IMG_0288.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/7604/5909/d02b/0a4c/86e1","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"86) Black Panther","altText":"Black Panther","credits":"","description":"After his standout introduction in _Captain America: Civil War_, 2018's _Black Panther_ allowed us to properly meet [Chadwick Boseman](https://www.empireonline.com/people/chadwick-boseman/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s T'Challa, and see his Wakandan kingdom in all its glory. Impeccably directed by _Creed_'s [Ryan Coogler](https://www.empireonline.com/people/ryan-coogler/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}, it's an Afrofuturistic vision oozing with cool, colourful regality, expressed through its Oscar-winning costume design, stunning set pieces and thrumming soundtrack. Soaring to billion dollar-plus box office takings, Black Panther's cultural impact cannot be understated � and after the tragic loss of Boseman in 2020, the film lives on as the defining role for a truly remarkable talent.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Black Panther](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/black-panther-review-2/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Black-Panther-Blu-Ray-Region-Free/dp/B079QGSMGV","price":null},"ImageMeta:53975":{"id":"53975","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"85) Shaun Of The Dead","fileName":"IMG_0286.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/76a9/3ebe/47fc/719c/e242","width":2514,"height":1416},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"85) Shaun Of The Dead","altText":"Shaun Of The Dead","credits":"","description":"Before its release, you might have been forgiven for thinking it would be _Spaced: The Movie_. The Mood For Love","credits":"","description":"Years before battling Shang-Chi in the MCU, Hong Kong acting legend [Tony Leung](https://www.empireonline.com/people/tony-leung/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} was director [Wong Kar-wai](https://www.empireonline.com/people/wong-kar-wai/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s greatest muse in gorgeous, simmering masterpieces like _Chungking Express_, _Happy Together_ � and this remarkable romance, perhaps their greatest collaboration. Leung plays a journalist renting an apartment in 1960s Hong Kong; his neighbour, played by Maggie Cheung, appears as lonely and lost as he is. It soon emerges their spouses are having an affair, and a romance of stolen glances and intimate longing begins to emerge.
