With its message that open-minded communication enables us to realise the things we have in common with those who appear vastly different, it feels like genuinely compulsive viewing for these troubled times.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Arrival](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/arrival-2-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B01MXEQRLW","price":null},"ImageMeta:54009":{"id":"54009","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"75) A Quiet Place","fileName":"IMG_0275.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/8191/3ebe/4762/8f9c/e2aa","width":1500,"height":843},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"75) A Quiet Place","altText":"A Quiet Place","credits":"","description":"Take a simple concept (don't make a sound, or aliens will get you), a stellar cast ([Emily Blunt](https://www.empireonline.com/people/emily-blunt/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}, Millicent Simmonds, Noah Jupe) and a director with a laser-sharp vision ([John Krasinski](https://www.empireonline.com/people/john-krasinski/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}) and what do you get? As it turns out, one of the most innovative, refreshing, unbearably tense horror movies of the 21st century. From the second it starts, the imposed silence of _A Quiet Place_ makes it a revelatory cinematic experience � as the Abbott family pad gently around their home, the store, the woods, you feel in your bones that one wrong step equals disaster. The (loudly) ticking time bomb of imminent childbirth sets the scene for a stellar scary finale, but it's the deeply endearing family dynamic that sets this apart.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of A Quiet Place](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/quiet-place-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Quiet-Place-Blu-Ray-Region-Free/dp/B07BQMX35R","price":null},"ImageMeta:54010":{"id":"54010","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"74) Trainspotting","fileName":"IMG_0274.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/825d/dbee/afae/3e68/feee","width":2060,"height":1159},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"74) Trainspotting","altText":"Trainspotting","credits":"","description":"For their follow up to the superb _Shallow Grave_, [Danny Boyle](https://www.empireonline.com/people/danny-boyle/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} (director), [Andrew Macdonald](https://www.empireonline.com/people/andrew-macdonald/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} (producer) and [John Hodge](https://www.empireonline.com/people/john-hodge/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} (screenwriter) foolhardily elected to film the supposedly unfilmable: [Irvine Welsh](https://www.empireonline.com/people/irvine-welsh/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s scrappy, episodic, multi-perspective novel about Edinburgh low-lives. The result couldn't have been more triumphant: the cinematic incarnation of 'Cool Britannia' came with a kick-ass soundtrack, and despite some dark subject matter, came with a punch-the-air uplifting pay-off.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Trainspotting](http://empireonline.com/movies/reviews/trainspotting-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Trainspotting-Blu-ray-McGregor-Bremner-Miller/dp/B084482B26?","price":null},"ImageMeta:54013":{"id":"54013","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"73) Mulholland Drive","fileName":"IMG_0273.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/8312/3ebe/47ea/0f9c/e2b5","width":1584,"height":891},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"73) Mulholland Drive","altText":"Mulholland Drive","credits":"","description":"[David Lynch](https://www.empireonline.com/people/david-lynch/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} messes with Hollywood itself in a mystery tale that's as twisted as the road it's named after, while presenting Tinseltown as both Dream Factory and a realm of Nightmares. It also put [Naomi Watts](https://www.empireonline.com/people/naomi-watts/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} on the map; her audition scene remains as stunning as it was 20 years ago.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Mulholland Drive](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/mulholland-drive-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B06XYBH7KC","price":null},"ImageMeta:54016":{"id":"54016","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"72) Rear Window","fileName":"IMG_0272.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/8412/f590/5eb0/3206/47f2","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"72) Rear Window","altText":"Rear Window","credits":"","description":"Photographer LB Jeffries ([James Stewart](https://www.empireonline.com/people/james-stewart/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}) is on sick leave, with a broken leg. He's bored to tears, so he starts spying on his neighbours. Then he witnesses a murder. OR DOES HE? [Alfred Hitchcock](https://www.empireonline.com/people/alfred-hitchcock/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} really knew how to take a corker of a premise and spin it into a peerless thriller (that's why they called him The Master Of Suspense), but _Rear Window_ also deserves praise for an astonishing set build: that entire Greenwich Village courtyard was constructed at Paramount Studios, complete with a drainage system that could handle all the rain.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Rear Window](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/rear-window-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00KQHWA9Q/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B00KQHWA9Q\u0026amp;linkId=20b30c86700e2ed33eaf047da4bbba0e","price":null},"ImageMeta:54020":{"id":"54020","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"71) Up","fileName":"IMG_0271.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/84db/3ebe/47eb/e69c/e2c2","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"71) Up","altText":"Up","credits":"","description":"A lot has been said about the opening to [Pete Docter](https://www.empireonline.com/people/pete-docter/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s Pixar masterpiece, and rightly so, wringing tears from the hardest of hearts with a wordless sequence set to [Michael Giacchino](https://www.empireonline.com/people/michael-giacchino/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s lovely, Oscar-winning score that charts the ups and downs of a couple's marriage. Yet while the majority of the film is more of a straight-ahead adventure tale (albeit one with a wacky bird and talking dogs), that doesn't make it any less satisfying. And let's be honest � the story of a man who uses balloons to float his house to a foreign land, accidentally picking up a young wilderness explorer scout as he does, feels perfectly Pixar.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Up](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/movie-2-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Up-Blu-ray-Pete-Docter/dp/B005MO75F2","price":null},"ImageMeta:54022":{"id":"54022","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"70) Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse","fileName":"IMG_0270.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/857e/5909/d0db/e74c/8768","width":3128,"height":1760},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"70) Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse","altText":"Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse","credits":"","description":"Having [Phil Lord](https://www.empireonline.com/people/phil-lord/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} and [Chris Miller](https://www.empireonline.com/people/chris-miller/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s names on a movie is regularly the guarantee of something great, but the full team behind this animated marvel (in both upper- and lower-case senses of the word) is what makes it work. [Bob Persichetti](https://www.empireonline.com/people/bob-persichetti/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}, [Peter Ramsey](https://www.empireonline.com/people/peter-ramsey/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}, and [Rodney Rothman](https://www.empireonline.com/people/rodney-rothman/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} all added something as directors (with Rothman co-writing alongside Lord) and their animators whipped up a visually dynamic, exciting, and heartwarming adventure that literally spans multiverses before the MCU introduced it. Bringing Miles Morales to the screen was a masterstroke, and [Shameik Moore](http:///people/shameik-moore/)'s vocal work gives him buckets of charm.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Spider-Man: Into The Spider-Verse](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/spider-man-spider-verse-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Spider-man-Into-Spider-Verse-Blu-ray-Region/dp/B07L3LL6F5","price":null},"ImageMeta:54026":{"id":"54026","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"69) Inglourious Basterds","fileName":"IMG_0269.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/86bb/dbee/af72/ce68/ff1c","width":3000,"height":1687},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"69) Inglourious Basterds","altText":"Inglourious Basterds","credits":"","description":"From its Sergio Leone-riffing opening to its insanely OTT, history-rewriting finale, [Tarantino'](https://www.empireonline.com/people/quentin-tarantino/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}s World War II caper never once fails to surprise and entertain. It's actually a big brainer, with [Denis Villeneuve](https://www.empireonline.com/people/denis-villeneuve/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} dipping into [Philip K. Dick'](https://www.empireonline.com/people/philip-k-dick/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}s universe and constructing a sequel that not only doesn't embarrass [Ridley Scott](https://www.empireonline.com/people/ridley-scott/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s original, but builds out that world, adding layers and texture while still feeling of a piece. Audiences still didn't exactly bite, but between [Harrison Ford](https://www.empireonline.com/people/harrison-ford/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} revisiting his iconic replicant hunter and [Ryan Gosling](https://www.empireonline.com/people/ryan-gosling/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} grappling with his own identity, _2049_ is a triumph of quiet character moments and glorious, sense-enveloping spectacle.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Blade Runner 2049](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/blade-runner-2049-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Blade-Runner-2049-Blu-ray-Harrison/dp/B07TQ8J8D3/","price":null},"ImageMeta:54070":{"id":"54070","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"56) The Social Network","fileName":"56 the social network.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/90b2/5165/438b/fe3b/7b01","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"56) The Social Network","altText":"The Social Network","credits":"","description":"Or, I'm Gonna Git You Zuckerberg. Portrayed as an �ber-ruthless ultra-nerd by [Jesse Eisenberg](https://www.empireonline.com/people/jesse-eisenberg/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}, it's fair to say the Facebook founder came out of [David Fincher](https://www.empireonline.com/people/david-fincher/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s social-media drama smelling less of roses than the stuff you grow them in. But it is great drama, expertly wrought by screenwriter [Aaron Sorkin](https://www.empireonline.com/people/aaron-sorkin/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}, who exploits the story's central paradox (a guy who doesn't get people makes a fortune getting people together online) to supremely juicy effect.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Social Network](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/social-network-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B005ELMSTQ/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B005ELMSTQ\u0026amp;linkId=70ccfeafbe7bc8d7768f002e24221751","price":null},"ImageMeta:54075":{"id":"54075","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"55) Taxi Driver","fileName":"55 Taxi Driver.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/911c/5909/d06a/1a4c/87c6","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"55) Taxi Driver","altText":"Taxi Driver","credits":"","description":"[Martin Scorsese](https://www.empireonline.com/people/martin-scorsese/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} and [Paul Schrader](https://www.empireonline.com/people/paul-schrader/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s gripping portrayal of a mentally crumbling Vietnam vet ([Robert De Niro](https://www.empireonline.com/people/robert-de-niro/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s Travis Bickle) who ultimately figures the only way to wash the crime-caked streets of New York is with a nice, big bloodbath. In [Keanu Reeves](https://www.empireonline.com/people/keanu-reeves/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} and [Patrick Swayze](https://www.empireonline.com/people/patrick-swayze/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}, we get two smouldering sides of the same anti-heroic coin; in W. Peter Iliff's screenplay, we get gems of dialogue like \"The correct term is 'babes', sir\"; and in [Kathryn Bigelow](https://www.empireonline.com/people/kathryn-bigelow/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s frenetic, confident direction, we get intense foot chases, fiery shoot-outs, epic surfing, and a spot of light skydiving. It shouldn't work: extreme sports, bank robberies _and_ male bonding? It's the film that brought Studio Ghibli � and anime at large � to mainstream Western audiences, an influence increasingly felt in the likes of _Moana_ and _Frozen II_.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Spirited Away](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/spirited-away-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/dp/B00M482XCY/ref=as_li_ss_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;linkCode=ll1\u0026amp;tag=emparticle142-21\u0026amp;linkId=21d796958369a86a91e9953a4f6aaaf4","price":null},"ImageMeta:54098":{"id":"54098","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"48) Ghostbusters","fileName":"48 Ghostbusters.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/9760/f590/5ec3/4206/488d","width":2048,"height":1152},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"48) Ghostbusters","altText":"Ghostbusters","credits":"","description":"As high-concept comedies go, _Ghostbusters_ is positively stratospheric: a story of demonic incursion... with gags! Ray Parker Jr was right. Over the longest, hottest summer's day in Brooklyn's Bed-Stuy, already boiling tensions between the African-Americans on the block and the Italian-Americans running a pizzeria eventually peak, erupting into violence. It's an absolutely flawless, funny, frightening piece of work, rammed with soon-to-be iconography from start to finish. But [Sidney Lumet](https://www.empireonline.com/people/sidney-lumet/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s film finds all its drama outside the courtroom itself and inside a jury deliberation room packed with fantastic character actors, who are forced to re-examine a seemingly straightforward case by lone-voice juror Henry Fonda. It's all about the value of looking at things differently, and a reminder that nothing is more important than great dialogue.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of 12 Angry Men](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/twelve-angry-men-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00B3V38DG/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B00B3V38DG\u0026amp;linkId=82f7f1c637906b2cd234aac1ce1d8338","price":null},"ImageMeta:54123":{"id":"54123","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"41) The Silence Of The Lambs","fileName":"41 Silence of the lambs.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/9b60/5909/d020/b74c/8816","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"41) The Silence Of The Lambs","altText":"The Silence Of The Lambs","credits":"","description":"Not only the first horror to win a Best Picture Oscar, it's also only the third movie to score in all four main categories: Picture, Director (the late, great [Jonathan Demme](https://www.empireonline.com/people/jonathan-demme/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}), Actress ([Jodie Foster](https://www.empireonline.com/people/jodie-foster/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}) and Actor ([Anthony Hopkins](https://www.empireonline.com/people/anthony-hopkins/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}) � the latter managing that despite technically being a supporting performer, with a mere 25-ish minutes of screen time. Even so, it feels like Foster's movie more than anybody's: her vulnerable-but-steely Clarice Starling is defined by her ability, not her gender.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Silence Of The Lambs](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/silence-lambs-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B001U3EOHQ/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B001U3EOHQ\u0026amp;linkId=d0901dda5d1947da329eca172d704e5e","price":null},"ImageMeta:54127":{"id":"54127","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"40)  Citizen Kane","fileName":"40 Citizen kane.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/9c19/5165/4386/2f3b/7b61","width":1280,"height":720},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"40)  Citizen Kane","altText":"Citizen Kane","credits":"","description":"[Orson Welles](https://www.empireonline.com/people/orson-welles/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}' game-changing fictional biopic, that managed to both launch his film career and ruin it at the same time (turns out it's not a good idea to piss off powerful newspaper magnates by viciously satirising them to a mass audience). Not only did he use impressive new film-making techniques that make it feel like a movie far younger than its 76 years, but its power-corrupts story still resonates loudly. Now more than ever, in fact.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Citizen Kane](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/citizen-kane-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B01FU85920/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B01FU85920\u0026amp;linkId=ab550d6f1fe3875ae1fbdd6538e2f99a","price":null},"ImageMeta:54130":{"id":"54130","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"39) Gladiator","fileName":"39 Gladiator.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/a127/dbee/af31/5c68/ffff","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"39) Gladiator","altText":"Gladiator","credits":"","description":"[Ridley Scott](https://www.empireonline.com/people/ridley-scott/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s comeback (after a bad run with 1492, White Squall and G.I. Jane). [Russell Crowe'](https://www.empireonline.com/people/russell-crowe/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}s big Hollywood breakthrough. Oscar.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Return Of The King](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/lord-rings-return-king-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B0030NL8MI/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B0030NL8MI\u0026amp;linkId=e1d3877eed73fd58ddfac02be586b560","price":null},"ImageMeta:54176":{"id":"54176","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"26) Die Hard","fileName":"26 Die hard.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/b12e/5165/43e6/133b/7c10","width":1503,"height":845},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"26) Die Hard","altText":"Die Hard","credits":"","description":"One man using only his wits and whatever he can extract from his environment. A Western which, in the form of [Bruce Willis](https://www.empireonline.com/people/bruce-willis/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}, not only convinced the world a TV-comedy star could be an action-hero, but also gave us one of our most seethingly charismatic big-screen villain-players: [Alan Rickman](https://www.empireonline.com/people/alan-rickman/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Die Hard](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/die-hard-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00CLDQCHE/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B00CLDQCHE\u0026amp;linkId=27c94ea9f9b3c513818faa7d996797b5","price":null},"ImageMeta:54180":{"id":"54180","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"25) Fight Club","fileName":"25 Fight Club.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/b191/5909/d009/314c/88c0","width":2559,"height":1439},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"25) Fight Club","altText":"Fight Club","credits":"","description":"After all the pre-release hype about how dark and brutal _Fight Club_ was, one of the most surprising things to discover on seeing it was just how funny it actually was. Is it really better than the original? A blockbuster of behemothic proportions. The weight of expectations on _Endgame_ � the culmination of 11 years of interweaving stories, following up the greatest cinematic cliffhanger since _The Empire Strikes Back_ � was immense, which only makes it more miraculous that the Russo Brothers (and writers [Christopher Markus](https://www.empireonline.com/people/christopher-markus/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} \u0026 Stephen McFeeley) delivered a thrilling, adventurous, emotional time-travelling trip through the entire MCU so far. It's no surprise that it made history as the first non-English language movie to do so � this South Korean genre-defying delight offers some of the biggest twists and expertly mounted tension in recent memory, with a family of excellent performances from [Song Kang-ho](https://www.empireonline.com/people/song-kang-ho/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}, Park So-dam, Choi Woo-shik and more. Stripping the chase movie down to its raw essentials (the plot is basically: run away... then run back again!), Miller expertly built the narrative through some of the most astonishing and gloriously operatic action scenes we'd seen in yonks. While also ensuring his female characters are the film's strongest; [Charlize Theron](https://www.empireonline.com/people/charlize-theron/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s Furiosa and Immortan Joe's ex-brides are inheriting a world \"killed\" by men...[Read Empire's review of Mad Max: Fury Road](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/mad-max-fury-road-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00QKS2CJI/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B00QKS2CJI\u0026amp;linkId=2dfa5b0fc670a991790c70ccd7a223ce","price":null},"ImageMeta:54228":{"id":"54228","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"11) Star Wars","fileName":"11 Star Wars.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/b9f5/3ebe/477b/3f9c/e48a","width":3840,"height":2160},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"11) Star Wars","altText":"Star Wars","credits":"","description":"[George Lucas](https://www.empireonline.com/people/george-lucas/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}' cocktail of fantasy, sci-fi, Western and World War II movie remains as culturally pervasive as ever. It's so mythically potent, you sense in time it could become a bona-fide religion...\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Star Wars](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/star-wars-episode-iv-new-hope-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B013GTXDZA/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B013GTXDZA\u0026amp;linkId=1265782ff63bd6f2092ffad195fea902","price":null},"ImageMeta:54231":{"id":"54231","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"10) Goodfellas","fileName":"10 Goodfellas.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/ba59/5165/43e0/333b/7c6f","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"10) Goodfellas","altText":"Goodfellas","credits":"","description":"Where [Coppola](https://www.empireonline.com/people/francis-ford-coppola/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} embroiled us in the politics of the Mafia elite, [Martin Scorsese](https://www.empireonline.com/people/martin-scorsese/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} drew us into the treacherous but seductive world of the Mob's foot soldiers. And its honesty was as impactful as its sudden outbursts of (usually [Joe Pesci](https://www.empireonline.com/people/joe-pesci/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}-instigated) violence. Not merely via Henry Hill's ([Ray Liotta](https://www.empireonline.com/people/ray-liotta/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}) narrative, but also Karen's (Lorraine Bracco) perspective: when Henry gives her a gun to hide, she admits, \"It turned me on.\"\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Goodfellas](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/goodfellas-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00UTDXZ0A/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B00UTDXZ0A\u0026amp;linkId=3f78348e403492e760da3956e0b3c3e7","price":null},"ImageMeta:54234":{"id":"54234","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"9) Raiders Of The Lost Ark","fileName":"9 Raiders.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/bb13/f590/5e77/c706/49ac","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"9) Raiders Of The Lost Ark","altText":"Raiders Of The Lost Ark","credits":"","description":"In '81, it must have sounded like the ultimate pitch: the creator of _Star Wars_ teams up with the director of _Jaws_ to make a rip-roaring, Bond-style adventure starring the guy who played Han Solo, in which the bad guys are the evillest ever (the Nazis) and the MacGuffin is a big, gold box which unleashes the power of God. It still sounds like the ultimate pitch.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Raiders Of The Lost Ark](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/raiders-lost-ark-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00G0O9XAI/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B00G0O9XAI\u0026amp;linkId=cb0c631bdb0637d1ea77b5693e511b5a","price":null},"ImageMeta:54237":{"id":"54237","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"8) Avengers: Infinity War","fileName":"8 Infinity War.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/bb98/3ebe/4758/9d9c/e49e","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"8) Avengers: Infinity War","altText":"Avengers: Infinity War","credits":"","description":"It was the biggest crossover event in cinematic history, and the biggest cliffhanger we never saw coming. After ten years and eighteen movies, Marvel took superhero filmmaking to a new level when they united all of Earth's mightiest heroes (and several more) against The Mad Titan himself � and incredibly, devastatingly, they lost. _Infinity War_ crashed much-loved characters into each other's orbits, flitting between planets at breakneck speed as the Avengers desperately tried to stop Thanos from clicking his fingers and wiping out half the universe. Spectacular action, punch-the-air moments and big-scale battles are perfectly balanced, as all things should be, with hilarious interplays and aching emotion. Cinema doesn't get much bigger, or better, than this.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Avengers: Infinity War](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/avengers-infinity-war-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Avengers-Infinity-War-DVD/dp/B07CNM5XS3","price":null},"ImageMeta:54241":{"id":"54241","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"7) Pulp Fiction","fileName":"7 Pulp Fiction.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/bc1a/5909/d0f3/1e4c/890c","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"7) Pulp Fiction","altText":"Pulp Fiction","credits":"","description":"If _Reservoir Dogs_ was a blood-spattered calling card, _Pulp Fiction_ saw [Quentin Tarantino](https://www.empireonline.com/people/quentin-tarantino/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} kick our front door off its hinges � and then get applauded for doing it with such goddamn panache. It wore its numerous influences on its sleeve and yet felt utterly, invigoratingly fresh and new. We happy? Yeah, we happy.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Pulp Fiction](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/pulp-fiction-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B005FE6ZLY/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B005FE6ZLY\u0026amp;linkId=fc8cd6e29cb8dad3c45f960b700bde51","price":null},"ImageMeta:54244":{"id":"54244","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"6) Jaws","fileName":"6 Jaws.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/bc72/3ebe/47f1/829c/e4a1","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"6) Jaws","altText":"Jaws","credits":"","description":"Forty-five years young, and [Spielberg](https://www.empireonline.com/people/steven-spielberg/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s breakthrough remains the touchstone for event-movie cinema. Not that any studio these days would dare put out a summer blockbuster that's half monster-on-the-rampage disaster, half guys-bonding-on-a-fishing-trip adventure. Maybe that's why it's never been rebooted. Or just because it's genuinely unsurpassable.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of Jaws](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/jaws-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B00LY0T7RM/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B00LY0T7RM\u0026amp;linkId=209f6429631a88a1474129b4cf1352f0","price":null},"ImageMeta:54247":{"id":"54247","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"5) The Shawshank Redemption","fileName":"5 Shawshank.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/bcdd/5165/4383/223b/7c83","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"5) The Shawshank Redemption","altText":"The Shawshank Redemption","credits":"","description":"The warm, leathery embrace of [Morgan Freeman](https://www.empireonline.com/people/morgan-freeman/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s narration... The reassuringly [Gary Cooper](https://www.empireonline.com/people/gary-cooper/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}-ish rumple of [Tim Robbins](https://www.empireonline.com/people/tim-robbins/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}' face... Odd that a movie which features such harshness and tragedy should remain a feel-good perennial � even odder when you consider it was a box-office flop on release. Few directorial debuts are so deftly constructed; no surprise, then, that [Frank Darabont](https://www.empireonline.com/people/frank-darabont/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} has yet to top it.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Shawshank Redemption](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/shawshank-redemption-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B001DOM032/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B001DOM032\u0026amp;linkId=f4c9fee9cf82d1e3e48e02e320d54f5f","price":null},"ImageMeta:54251":{"id":"54251","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"4) The Dark Knight","fileName":"4 dark knight.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/bd81/3ebe/47b5/fa9c/e4ac","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"4) The Dark Knight","altText":"The Dark Knight","credits":"","description":"Easily as influential on the genre as that other summer '08 comic-book movie, _Iron Man_, [Christopher Nolan](https://www.empireonline.com/people/christopher-nolan/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s _Batman Begins_ sequel works wonders because he never saw it as a superhero film. It's closer to a [Michael Mann](https://www.empireonline.com/people/michael-mann/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} crime epic � except instead of [Pacino](https://www.empireonline.com/people/al-pacino/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} and [De Niro](https://www.empireonline.com/people/robert-de-niro/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} in a diner, you get a bloke dressed as a bat and a psychotic clown in a police interrogation room. With, er, [Aaron Eckhart](https://www.empireonline.com/people/aaron-eckhart/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} as [Val Kilmer](https://www.empireonline.com/people/val-kilmer/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}...\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Dark Knight](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/dark-knight-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B001CEE1WG/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B001CEE1WG\u0026amp;linkId=4f97f5225fecb32a453f1a63940a8bc0","price":null},"ImageMeta:54253":{"id":"54253","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"3) The Godfather","fileName":"3 Godfather.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/be32/5165/433b/cc3b/7c8f","width":3840,"height":2160},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"3) The Godfather","altText":"The Godfather","credits":"","description":"[Stanley Kubrick](https://www.empireonline.com/people/stanley-kubrick/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer} once described [Francis Ford Coppola](https://www.empireonline.com/people/francis-ford-coppola/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s adaptation of [Mario Puzo](https://www.empireonline.com/people/mario-puzo/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s novel as the best film ever made � though having previously topped this list, this time it falls to bronze position. At once an art movie and a commercial blockbuster, _The Godfather_ marked the dawn of the age of the mega-movie. An icon of the gangster genre, its imprinted in popular culture � \"Luca Brasi sleeps with the fishes\", the horse's head in the bed � but the first instalment of Brando's cotton-cheeked patriarch's fight for power is so much more than those moments. With performances, style and substance to savour, it's managed to both smash box office records and live on as a staple of cinematic canon.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Godfather](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/godfather-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/Godfather-Blu-ray-Region-Free/dp/B004R0TV4K/?tag=emparticle102-2","price":null},"ImageMeta:54256":{"id":"54256","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"2) Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back","fileName":"2 ESB.jpg","path":"legacy/media/619d/bf59/3ebe/4721/a59c/e4be","width":1920,"height":1080},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"2) Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back","altText":"Star Wars: The Empire Strikes Back","credits":"","description":"The original \"this one's darker\" sequel, and by far the strongest of the saga. Not just because the baddies win (temporarily), or because it Force-slammed us with that twist (\"No, I am your father\"). Empire super-stardestroys thanks to the way it deepens the core relationships � none more effectively than Han and Leia's. She loves him. He knows. And it still hurts.\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Empire Strikes Back](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/star-wars-episode-v-empire-strikes-back-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B013GTXFIU/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B013GTXFIU\u0026amp;linkId=67f20332ce9ce51279c06451a5d23ef8","price":null},"ImageMeta:54261":{"id":"54261","__typename":"ImageMeta","image":{"__typename":"Image","name":"1) The Lord Of The Rings: The Fellowship Of The Ring","fileName":"1 Fellowship.jpeg","path":"legacy/media/619d/bfe9/5909/d08f/544c/892d","width":3200,"height":1800},"amazonProduct":null,"titleText":"1) The Lord Of The Rings: The Fellowship Of The Ring","altText":"The Lord Of The Rings: The Fellowship Of The Ring","credits":"","description":"A wizard is never late. Nor is he early. He arrives precisely when he... well, you know the rest. It might have taken 20 years for [Peter Jackson](https://www.empireonline.com/people/peter-jackson/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s plucky fantasy to clamber, Mount-Doom-style, to the very pinnacle of our greatest-movies pantheon. But here it is, brighter and more resplendent than ever._The Fellowship Of The Ring_ contains so much movie. Even at the halfway point, as the characters take a breather to bicker in Rivendell, you already feel sated, like you've experienced more thrills, more suspense, more jollity and ethereal beauty than a regular film could possibly muster up. But Jackson is only getting started. Onwards his adventure hustles, to the bravura dungeoneering of Khazad-dum, to the sinisterly serene glades of Lothlorien, to the final requiem for flawed Boromir amidst autumnal leaves. As _Fellowship_ thrums to its conclusion, finally applying the brakes with a last swell of [Howard Shore](https://www.empireonline.com/people/howard-shore/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}'s heavenly score, you're left feeling euphoric, bereft and hopeful, all at the same time. _The Two Towers_ has the coolest battle. _The Return Of The King_ boasts the most batshit, operatic spectacle. But Fellowship remains the most perfect of the three, matching every genius action beat with a soul-stirring emotional one, as its Middle-earth-traversing gang swells in size in the first act, then dwindles in the third. This oddball suicide squad has so much warmth and wit, they're not just believable as friends of each other � they've come to feel like they're our pals too.An ornately detailed masterwork with a huge, pulsing heart, it's just the right film for our times � full of craft, conviction and a belief that trudging forward, step by step, in dark days is the bravest act of all. Its ultimate heroes aren't the strongest, or those with the best one-liners, but the ones who just keep going. And so _Fellowship_ endures: a miracle of storytelling, a feat of filmmaking and still the gold standard for cinematic experiences. Right, now that's decided, who's up for second breakfast?\n\n  \n\n[Read Empire's review of The Lord Of The Rings: The Fellowship Of The Ring](https://www.empireonline.com/movies/reviews/lord-rings-fellowship-ring-review/){:target=_blank :rel=noopener noreferrer}","orientation":null,"caption":"","actionText":null,"actionLink":null,"amazonId":"https://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/product/B0030NL8LY/ref=as_li_tl?ie=UTF8\u0026amp;tag=baucitnet-21\u0026amp;camp=1634\u0026amp;creative=6738\u0026amp;linkCode=as2\u0026amp;creativeASIN=B0030NL8LY\u0026amp;linkId=d6f321ab024a5df625b21de7c2652dd4","price":null},"ImageMeta:205721":{"id":"205721","__typename":"ImageMeta","altText":"The Godfather","credits":"","caption":"","image":{"__typename":"Image","fileName":"the-godfather.jpg","name":"the-godfather.jpg","width":1500,"height":844,"path":"empire/2022/01"}},"Article:54591":{"id":"54591","__typename":"Article","publicationDate":1642955700000,"lastModifiedAt":1674492894000,"furl":"best-movies-2","title":"The 100 Best Movies Of All Time","subtitle":"","isAdvertorial":false,"isWordpressSite":true,"sourceUrl":"","sourceText":"","seo":{"__typename":"Seo","index":"index","follow":"follow"},"author":{"__ref":"Author:42821"},"author_custom":"Team Empire","categories":[{"__ref":"Category:13"}],"sponsor":null,"_layout":[{"__typename":"LayoutItem","content":{"__typename":"Content","text":"It�s a big question: what are the best movies of all time? And it�s one with many answers � there are all kinds of reasons why the greatest films ever made endure in the way they do. They create unforgettable images, conjure overwhelming emotions, craft thrilling stories, and deliver characters who leap off the screen. There�s astonishing technical mastery that brings those stories to life, plots that twist and turn in all kinds of unexpected ways, performances that help us fall head-over-heels for people who don�t exist, and transcendent experiences that change our heads and hearts. The best films � from classic movies that have stood the test of time, to contemporary works that changed the game � offer heartwarming comfort, iconic scares, big laughs, and pulse-pounding suspense, becoming firm audience favourites and garnering critical acclaim.","items":null,"url":null,"provider":null,"image":null,"title":null,"subTitle":null,"caption":null,"altText":null,"credits":null,"price":null,"amazonId":null,"amazonAward":null,"awardStamp":null,"description":null,"actionLinkText":null,"actionLink":null,"actionText":null,"tabRatingsTitle":null,"tabRatingsContentTitle":null,"tabSpecsTitle":null,"tabSpecsContentTitle":null,"tabFeaturesTitle":null,"tabFeaturesContent":null,"tabFeaturesContentTitle":null,"tabProsandConsTitle":null,"tabProsandConsContentTitle":null,"tabProsContent":null,"tabConsContent":null,"specificationTable":null,"ratingsTable":null,"isLargeVariant":null,"overlayLogo":null,"overlayLogoPosition":null,"coverImage":null,"template":null,"images":null,"amazonProduct":null},"handles":null,"type":"content"},{"__typename":"LayoutItem","content":{"__typename":"Content","text":"In creating a list of the 100 best movies of all time, _Empire_ asked readers to share their picks � a selection of movies that comfort, challenge, and pioneer.
